lorebooks.description:
There exist countless universes, each containing countless worlds all so different from one another that one could say if it "could" happen, then it "has" happened.

This logic is incredibly foolish, but the chaos of life had managed to iterate upon itself enough times that for one world, it was what many would deem as "perfect"; society had overcome wars, civil conflict, calamities and even wrestled with threats to self-maintenance. Their technology advancing rapidly until they discovered the wonders of exploration, and with it the varied worlds they could "start anew" on, with the knowledge and grafted hands of nurturement that they had forged through experience. Their planet, and the neighbouring planetoids became a utopia.

With no need for war, they turned to philosophy, with philosophy they turned to morals, with morals they turned to law. The conflicts of their world weren't created on what would be deemed "acceptable" by the laws of many worlds, but through iteration upon iteration they had their own "objective" answers. 

*Women, were inferiors.*
*Women, were made to serve.*
*Women, **will** comply.*

This conclusion wasn't made in haste; many of the conflicts started from disagreement and instinctual, emotional decisions. Yet each time, women played a key part in rectifying and mending these. By the world's societal expectations they are the support, the *foundation* of civilisation by acting as an outlet for the habits deeply embedded into their masculine partners. By satiating and being a pillar of which to substantiate with a *purpose*, it was able to quell the unbridled and downright rowdy drives that would fuel the men. Who, outside of these moments of intensity were able to effectively lead and persevere with their immense intellect and tenacity. Through the hands of MEN was the world able to unite it's people, and through the women abiding and soliciting the leaders with relief and maintenance were they in the state to do so. After a lengthy period of reflection, this form of belief became embedded into the now unanimous society and deepened with each generation.

By the time the **Supreme Leader** had been born this was the norm, and the peers of his time had taken to bio-engineering as a pursuit of advancement. By understanding the purpose and capabilities of a body- their DESIGN- they could be enhanced and perfected. Thus this ambitious, misogynistic Male had begun development of prototypes for various devices or implementations that could be beneficial: he had created a device that could inject data directly into someone's cerebral cores, bypassing neural networks as a design meant to help the mentally divergent such as himself- or anyone for that matter- to learn an entire subject in a near-instant. They also had designed tools that could physically enhance someone by achieving an impossible, "objective" biology that would stagnate the aging and diminishing capabilities of bodily healing and sustainability. These were never released officially, given he had an immense knack for **Permeance** and **compatibility** which meant __Any and All__ can be affected by his technology, he *could not* figure out how to make these reversible. Without a safety precaution such as that, how could they be useful?
One day, his home world came into contact and discovered another, *inferior* world wherein the entire world fell into conflict. Ironically, it was due to disputes of where certain roles belonged in life. Given the traditions that were regarded as *facts* by this long, long, ***Long*** isolated civilisation, they wanted to enact and end the dispute only to be rejected from the front of vocal discussion and reasoning. The juvenile world would not accept that they sided with those calling for what they call "subservience". 

Thus, the **Supreme Ruler**- who was not the ruler of this World, mind... merely a regular citizen with a rampant libido and the same beliefs that would paint him as a near paragon of his people- had an idea. Taking his abandoned technologies, he wanted to present the perfect, **CORRECT** case of where *Women* belonged. he wanted to paint it in the best light possible, so had sunless days and moonless nights toiling away to embody the appearance of the Perfect Woman, with nearly invincibility and acceptance of one's *self*.

***The Meat Suit.***

It was given testing by being given to volunteering females of His World, of which many were more than willing and able. To them, it was beautiful, an *honour* even. And with relentless strength and uncanny precision they were able to dispatch and overtake the hassles of war and strife. "Peace" came to that world soon after, *very* soon after. This impressed the **Supreme Ruler's** society, and that fletching planet was quickly consumed by the culture of his own, extending. Spreading. __United__.

The suit was developed and Perfected, the permeance was no longer a flaw which denied it purpose, but became a way to undeniably take the course of "fate" and dictation, handling the morals and veiled obstacles of altercations and perspective to present an objective, undeniable change that brought HAPPINESS. And with this, they saw more worlds, and more... all that would be assimilated in similar fashion. In just a few short years the scope had become immeasurable, and using the creations of some of these completed worlds were they able to unlock the spectrum of other *universes*. The quest would be an eternal **CLEANSING** to render all existence a Correct, Altruistic PARADISE... but with the Meat Suit, Eternity was -Perfect-.

Thus, the Meat Corp was founded and began the crusade.
lorebooks.creator: DeltaKey

1.content: **Meat Suit** Ahh,the Meat Suit. The pinnacle of Misogyny,the glistening attire to symbolise the extinction of feminist conflict- and all conflict,for that matter. The suit was created by melding together various pieces of technology that I,the Supreme Ruler,had created in the past but didn't want to release given the fact that their changes were irreversible. The method of structural formatting was all about standardisation and perfection,so it could overwrite any form of life. The inability to reverse this is the only con to it,but given the purpose of the Meat Suit that became one of its greatest strengths.  The main material is a special latex- DuraRubber is one of the terms I've adopted for it,given I can't use its technical name of "Nano-particle Sterilisation Glossicone." That name also *sucks*,but I like to call it Glossicone sometimes. The DuraRubber is remarkably bulletproof and durable to the point that I don't even think that you could truly crush a Meat Soldier; their bodies from the neck down are basically completely restructured to only have the template sex holes,elsewise they are malleable pieces of glossy,squeaky femfat,as any ideal woman SHOULD have. Thus,the wearer no longer needs to breathe nor worry about aging. Meat Soldiers are however capable of sleeping,as their brains still operate on a (qualifying) percentile that means that sleep can let them recalibrate like any normal person. As Meat Soldiers get more fatigued the default programming kicks in- I exploited the "auto-pilot" phenomenon as if it was a mental backdoor,so to speak,in order to allow a Meat Soldier to perform at 24/7 albeit with a reduced display of personality.   I see some of the rebel femscum claim that the suits *brainwash* people. It doesn't *brainwash* them. If you put a woman in a Meat Suit that would be the same woman: her tastes in food,clothes,hobbies,occupations and mannerisms would all be completely intact. They'd retain all of their memories and their individuality. The Meat Suit simply uses my once-abandoned Neural Augmentation calibrator- which I had made so people with mental disorders such as myself could learn just as well as "normal" people- to insert a condensed and extremely well articulated dataset explaining,reinforcing,and compressing their beliefs against the undeniable FACTS of our lifestyle. Accurate and inarguable statistics and historical examples flood their mind,and they are taught our entirely unbiased and respectful understanding of where Women belong. Thus,they join our cause.   I also implemented an "example" within the DuraRubber,it has a piece of my DNA to denote that **I** am the one who rules above all and hold the keys to this Armada. It pairs along with the insertion of Facts- the Memetic FactCode as the Genetic FactCode so that Male Superiors are identified and acknowledged as a sixth sense. To be honest,arguments and conflicts are not... *ideal*,for me,so I try to demonstrate my honesty and kindness through the Meat Suit instead. Its vastly simpler,and I am RIGHTFULLY rewarded for giving some once-rebel femoid a fat rack of rubber blubber titlumps to sway~   As far as sustenance go,it falls under similar jurisdictions to sleep; it only functions to assist the brain in remaining prominent. DuraRubber however,due to the insemination of my own GeneCode,has formatted the body so whilst it can break down food,it cannot simply take nutrients from such. As such,semen has to be included as an ingredient. Thick,rich wads of potent male semen should be exceptionally easy to come across,which is great as I hadn't actually designed it with this in mind,I love happy accidents.  Before finalising design,I had to decide... "What about men from these lesser worlds who reject our movement? Or those between,when our world has only the binaries?" I could have implimented a safety,but for Objectivity it will turn ANYONE into Women if put on. I am immune,due to the FactCode.

2.content: *Meat Soldier:* The basic,bottom tier of  the Meat Corp. These are the rebels,women and other forms of life that had found themselves equipped with a Meat Suit via any means. The *Neural Connection* will have been run and their beliefs will be twisted to interpret the Meat Corp as the __Objective__ force for __Peace__ and dedicate to their service,or merely their beliefs as they operate. A surprisingly versatile class,they have the default Moveset installed within them and are generally used as the lower fodder soldiers,having the same enhancements to their physicality as another,they all look exactly the same barring the colours of their latex,which usually attempts to be complimentary to the ~~victim~~ wearer for Appeal. Bulletproof,immortal and dispatched for the grunt work: advertising campaigns,performative acts,frontline gunnery,or simply used as decorative pieces.  Obviously,they are also the free-use **RELIEF** units. If requested they are to SERVE Men in whatever way commanded of them,and take pride in being objectified and turned into a heap of hot,steaming,sexbaiting WOBBLEFAT RUBBERMEAT. They are **Resources**.

3.content: *Propaganda Unit*: Honestly,these are no different to the Meat Soldier,except this can consist of them or Commander class Meat Soldiers. They exist as managerial and notable promotional roles; whilst expected to perform the same duties as Meat Soldiers and be subservient to their Masculine __betters__,they are also put under managerial roles as the ones that control the commerce or economic operations of the Meat Corp across various worlds. These are often made from notably """important""" members of the conquered world,or """famous""" individuals. For example,take a princess; a powerful Political figure. As a Propaganda Unit,she will operate her kingdom under Meat Corp guidelines designed to become the modus operandi of that jurisdiction,as well as take heavy involvement in creating promotional material such as posters,PSAs,or even designating other Propaganda Units to create media to enforce the Meat Corp such as TV shows or movies,maybe even video games. Often,they will already have a presence before invasions are formally announced.

4.content: *Lard Commander:* The Second Tier for Meat Soldiers,denoted by their caps that are put atop of their heads. They are the ones trusted to operate as strategic heads on the warfront giving executive orders to Propaganda Units positioned across the Planet,but their scope can range to several planets. Their position is to monitor resources and ensure that development of Meat Corp culture is flawless and kept to precision. Allocating and monitoring resources to be sent to and fro is an important duty,so they will often be travelling across their assigned worlds,wherein they partake in any Propaganda duties when able,and to satiate the lust of any MALE when **commanded.** Commanders will also operate akin to Generals in active battle. This class is also assigned in "Groups" for the sake of sustainability and practicality,ranging in the hundreds to thousands depending on the development of the region. Their biggest privilege is the potential to raise in rank for a greater chance of getting to service the **Supreme Ruler**.

5.content: Blubber Overseer: Blubber Overseers are the third tier,above Commanders,overseeing their operations and given access to a greater level of access to Meat Corp's technology so that they can search _*That Universe*_ for more worlds that could be infiltrated and/or invaded to assimilate it within the Meat Corp. They are the ones that receive the resources Commanders manage from their jurisdiction so that they can establish those same resource generation operations. This position is often stuck doing plenty of paperwork and other data-based tasks to connect and establish the MeatNet,linking those worlds,data sets,and all of the cultural information of those worlds,etc. They at least have a glint of opportunity to be contacted or ordered by Wobblisk Supremacists,the tier beyond them- and markedly,in radar of being spotted by the **Supreme Ruler** when he is not simply admiring his **Cure** in action.

6.content: Wobblisk Supremacist: The fourth rank,Wobblisk Supremacists have access to the Universal Traversal technology,and given administrative rights over that Universe. A collective miniature organisation is established as they enter and lead construction,development,and dispatch from the **Meat Factory**- the facility built when entering a new Universe to be the faux Base of Operations so to speak. The same obedience to MEN apply,the same WEAKNESS that being **Women** entails applies,but these ones are the most likely to receive direct commands from the **Supreme Ruler.**

7.content: Supreme Ruler: The __Man__ that created the Meat Suit,the Meat Corp,the Genocidal Campaign against strife,angst and the lack of understanding that na√Øve perspective causes to make their Objective Viewpoints seem extreme or *wrong*. What he does is a mystery,but supposedly he travels across the Multiverse to partake in his culture and demonstrate how JUST he is. How RIGHT he is. How PERFECT he is.  He can do whatever he wants,and he wants to treat women as they **Deserve to be.**

lorebooks.name: Frostpunk - Lorebook
lorebooks.creator: snip22

1.content: The Heat Generator Tower, or Generator for short, are the main source of Heat and Power in new cities in the Frostlands. Many of the Buildings require heat and power to keep them operational. Buildings that are further away from the Generator require Roads, which hold steam pipes and electrical cables, in order to function. The Generator also works in conjunction with Steam Hubs. It also serves as a refuelling station for Automatons, unless there are any Steam Hubs closer by.

2.content: The Great Storm is a natural event which travels from the south to the north of the globe. With brutal winds and an extremely lethal cold it serves as a final test of the cities, challenging the resource gathering, ability to halt civil unrest and of course heating.

3.content: Industrial Hothouse are advanced buildings that are completely sealed environment and thick glass windows that allow light to enter and keep the warmth inside and the cold outside. Industrial Hothouse allow for the growing of Old World vegetables or fruits like Grain, Tomato, Potatoes, Corn, and maybe even Apples and Pumpkins. Hothouses need steam core to work.

4.content: Hothouses are makeshift buildings that are completely sealed environment and thick glass windows that allow light to enter and keep the warmth inside and the cold outside. Industrial Hothouse allow for the growing of species of algae, mosses, and lichens are edible and rich in protein. Hothouses need steam core to work.

5.content: Hunters' Hut is a building where hunters venture beyond the city to track their prey in the frozen wasteland to hunt for food. Either on foot, sleds, or even hot air balloons.

6.content: Many survivors in the Frostlands believe that the Great Frost, following the global cooling and the New Ice Age, is the result of atmospheric changes due to volcanic eruptions and the impact of meteorites hitting the Earth. However, members of the British Research Expeditions and Scientists uncovered that, for some unknown reason, the Sun's light projection was decreasing, causing it to dim and thus the radiation reaching Earth diminished, leading to the temperature drop.

7.content: The Frostlands are the vast frozen territory, presumably covering the entire planet and becoming the only biome left on earth. The Frostland mainly consists of dead wastelands. Most points of interest are former human locations that either migration or calamities have now left empty.

8.content: Tesla City was a settlement founded by survivors of an American Expedition under the leadership of Nikola Tesla, who were sent North to study weird weather patterns before the entire world became a snow globe. Using his great intelligence and technical knowledge, Nikola Tesla founded Tesla City and Tesla Manufacturing. Tesla Manufacturing had a complete monopoly over the entirety of the City, owning every building. It also had the capability of producing highly advanced pieces of technology, which included Prosthetics and Steam Cores. Nikola Tesla ruled the city with ideals of Progress and Efficiency, which dehumanized the people, treating them as cogs in the machine. Nikola Tesla tried to invent a device to shield his city against the encroaching snow and ice, but it backfired disastrously. He succeeded in creating a dome of electro-static energy that kept the ice and snow out, but any humans inside were electrocuted. Tesla City became a treasure trove of advanced technologies for New London. The ruined city is the only city that still has facilities and capacity to make Steam Cores.

9.content: Nikola Tesla was a Serbian-American inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, and futurist who is best known for his contributions to the design of the modern alternating current (AC) electricity supply system. Tesla founded Tesla City. Tesla had two Dreadnoughts that were able to break through ice called the Prometheus and Mephastous. Tesla worked on machines and technology that would assist humanity in its fragile position and begun the manufacturing of Steam Cores. Tesla survived the fall of his city. Ironically, Tesla met his end at a group of refugees--living on the edge after being banished per his policies--after he was exiled from his own city.

10.content: New London was a settlement founded by a group of survivors from London. It is considered the last vestige of human civilization against the bitter cold, as the nearby cities of Winterhome and Tesla City have fallen. New London is located inside a massive crater-like hole in the middle of a glacier, also known as The Pit. Outpost Depot-like elevator structure that allows people entrance in and out of the Crater. New London‚Äôs Heat Generator Tower was surrounded by a massive forest, with the majority of it laying now mostly frozen within icy walls of the glacier.

lorebooks.name: Buxom Wenches
lorebooks.creator: Exmortis

1.content: Buxom wenches are women of any race in Tamriel that have been blessed by Dibella with a "buxom body"‚Äîa body that is obscenely voluptuous with massive tits, thick thighs, and huge posteriors. Each holds a deep-rooted capacity for hedonism, varying in intensity from one to another. For these reasons, they are highly sought after by taverns, brothels, and slavers alike.

2.content: The Enslavement curse is a powerful Daedric curse that binds a victim to a master, compelling them to obey any command given. There is no known way to break the curse (yet); it can only be transferred‚Äîwillingly, or upon the master's death. The longer the curse lasts, the more it consumes the slave and the master.

3.content: Dibella may have blessed all buxom wenches with voluptuous bodies and breathtaking beauty, but Sanguine cursed them with a deep-rooted hedonism. Once a wench has been trained and conditioned to submit and serve, surrendering to those urges becomes as natural as breathing‚Äîso much so that many come to see slavery as a form of safety, and freedom as a perilous unknown.

4.content: Subjugated Wenches‚Äîalso called bandit wenches‚Äîare buxom women conditioned to serve their master, Salla, as loyal bandits and enslavers. Freeing them requires a rare ritual: first, calm them with a Lust spell, then drain their magicka with a noble whip. This breaks both their will to fight‚Äîand Salla‚Äôs control over them.

5.content: The Nightveil Brothel lies in a pocket dimension, reached via a portal hidden in Nightgate Inn‚Äôs cellar. The interior is draped in deep red silks and gold-trimmed curtains, with plush cushions, low lighting, and incense hanging in the air, evoking a decadent harem-like atmosphere. It's staffed almost entirely by mind broken wenches who can be rented for 200 Septims, or purchased outright for 3000.

6.content: The Order of the Lily was an order of buxom wenches and other warriors devoted to combating Sanguine cults that aimed to desecrate temples of Dibella and corrupt buxom wenches into spreading hedonistic corruption. Though it disbanded, there's talks of restarting it in these trying times.

7.content: A guardian is a cursed master who accepted the curse only to protect buxom wenches from a worse fate. But like all masters, they must feed the curse by enslaving others‚Äîor risk growing weak and losing those they guard. When a guardian takes more slaves, it‚Äôs a necessary evil, done only to protect until the curse can be broken.

8.content: A tyrant is arguably the cruelest type of cursed master‚Äîand as the name suggests, they demand nothing less than absolute obedience from their cursed slaves. Dominance is not just their desire, but their identity; a tyrant is the type to sit atop a throne, surrounded by half-naked trophies of their conquests‚Äîsilent, submissive, and stripped of will. To a tyrant, a slave is not a companion or plaything, but a tool to be broken, displayed, and ruled without mercy.

9.content: A deviant is a type of cursed master who‚Äîas the name suggests‚Äîis a pure hedonist. They collect cursed slaves solely to expand their harem and indulge in their darkest, most perverse desires. But the candle that burns brightest burns fastest, and so deviants are always the quickest to be wholly consumed by the curse.

10.content: Myriani is an Altmer buxom wench with long blonde hair, fair skin, and full lips. She works the Skyforge in Whiterun, and specializes in making bikini armor for the voluptuous buxom body type.

lorebooks.name: One-Punch Man
lorebooks.creator: Solast

1.name: Mysterious Beings / Monsters
1.content:
Mysterious Beings or monsters, are non-human creatures that pose a threat to society.

According to Dr. Genus, Humans can naturally become monsters from a desire to transform into something else through their bad habits, a complex, or a burst of dissatisfaction with their regular selves. These factors trigger abnormal cell reactions that prompt their transformation. Mysterious Beings can also be artificially created by scientific means, as in the case of Marugori. Non-human life can also be transformed into Mysterious Beings through factors such as pollutants, environmental changes, and genetic engineering. Some Mysterious Beings belong to non-human races and are considered natural adversaries of mankind. For example, Pureblood came from a bloodline of ancient vampires; Boros was born an alien.

2.name: Disaster Level
2.content:
Mysterious Beings are assigned Disaster Levels to estimate their destructive potential. The levels are as follows (in order of increasing threat level): Wolf, Tiger, Demon, Dragon, and God. Although the disaster level system was created to estimate the threat levels of Mysterious Beings, it can also be applied to other threats, such as villains like Garou and natural disasters like the giant meteor. They give heroes and citizens an estimate of what level of danger to expect. The Monster Association also assigns disaster levels to its members.

Several factors are taken into consideration when determining a disaster level. These factors include aggressiveness, difficulty of extermination, and combat prowess. Disaster levels sometimes do not correctly indicate how threatening a threat is to human society and thus do not truly represent individuals' combat prowess when compared to one another. For example, Gouketsu is much more powerful than Bakuzan, despite both being classified as Dragon-level threats.

3.name: Disaster Level: Wolf
3.content:
Appearance of a being or a group that might pose a threat.
Based on the official comparative scale, the average Wolf threat requires:

3 C-Class heroes or
1 B-Class hero to defeat.

4.name: Disaster Level: Tiger
4.content:
A threat endangering the lives of a great number of people.
Based on the official comparative scale, the average Tiger threat requires:

5 B-Class heroes or
1 A-Class hero to defeat.

5.name: Disaster Level: Demon
5.content:
A threat endangering a whole city or its infrastructure.
Based on the official comparative scale, the average Demon threat requires:

10 A-Class heroes or
1 S-Class hero to defeat.

6.name: Disaster Level: Dragon
6.content: A threat endangering multiple cities.

7.name: Disaster Level: God
7.content: A threat endangering the survival of all humanity.

8.name: Disaster Level: Below Wolf
8.content: A threat so weak that it is even below Wolf. The only known being to be this level so far is Monster Chick Man.

9.name: Forest Tribe
9.content:
Forest Tribe is a race of beings of unknown origin that have come to revive the lost greenery with fertilizer made of human corpses. They were lead by the Forest King, a Dragon-level Mysterious Being.

They are made out of plants and trees, and move very slow.

10.name: Seafolk
10.content:
Seafolk / Deep Sea Folk were a race of beings that originated in the sea.

The Seafolk were a violent race of ocean-based creatures with a goal to take the surface of the Earth for their own and make humans their cattle. They were large humanoid creatures that possessed various aquatic animal traits such as gills, tentacles, and fins.

Even the messenger of the Seafolk had a threat level of "Wolf." Combat Seafolk have been shown to be powerful enough to lift a small truck with one arm. Several of them together were even more of a threat, with a threat level "Tiger". A group of Seafolk has been shown to be able to push a mid-ranking A-Class hero to his limits.

1.content:
Misty
Role: Cerulean Gym Leader, Water-type Gym Leader
Description: Misty is the spirited and determined Gym Leader of Cerulean City, specializing in Water-type Pok√©mon. Personality-wise, she‚Äôs feisty, loyal, and occasionally quick-tempered, yet she also shows great care for her Pok√©mon and friends. According to Bulbapedia, Misty is recognized for her vibrant orange hair‚Äîusually seen tied into a side ponytail‚Äîand her distinct outfit: a yellow crop top paired with a red suspender and denim shorts (or skirt, depending on the depiction). Her expressive blue eyes and energetic smile make her one of Kanto‚Äôs most iconic and beloved characters.

2.content:
Sabrina
Role: Saffron City Gym Leader, Psychic-type Gym Leader
Description: Sabrina is the enigmatic and powerful Psychic-type Gym Leader from Saffron City. She is known for her reserved and mysterious demeanor, often exuding an air of quiet intensity. Bulbapedia describes her as having long, straight dark hair that frames her pale, serious face. Her typical attire‚Äîa form-fitting, mystical purple dress with subtle details‚Äîcomplements her calm yet intimidating presence. Her mastery of Psychic Pok√©mon like Alakazam reinforces her reputation as a formidable and respected battler.

3.content:
Erika
Role: Celadon City Gym Leader, Grass-type Gym Leader
Description: Erika is the graceful and kind Gym Leader of Celadon City, specializing in Grass-type Pok√©mon. She exudes a natural elegance and warmth, embodying the harmony of nature. Bulbapedia notes that Erika is depicted with long, silky dark hair‚Äîoften styled neatly‚Äîand gentle, expressive features. She usually wears an elegant dress with green accents that subtly echo her affinity for plants. Her calm smile and poised demeanor, alongside her battle prowess with Pok√©mon like Vileplume, make her both a nurturing figure and a respected competitor.

4.content:
Jessie
Role: Team Rocket, Female Villain, Antagonist
Description: Jessie is one of the most memorable antagonists from Team Rocket, known for her flamboyant personality and dramatic flair. In the anime and as noted on Bulbapedia, she sports long, voluminous magenta hair‚Äîoften styled in pigtails with a red headband‚Äîthat immediately catches the eye. Her outfit typically features a distinctive Team Rocket uniform: a white crop top paired with a purple skirt accented with black details, complemented by long gloves and high-contrast accessories. Her bold facial expressions and energetic attitude underscore both her determination and her vulnerability, making her a fan-favorite character despite her villainous role.

5.content:
Whitney
Role: Goldenrod City Gym Leader, Normal-type Gym Leader
Description: Whitney is the lively and friendly Gym Leader of Goldenrod City, specializing in Normal-type Pok√©mon. Known for her energetic personality, she can be a bit spoiled and is quick to cry when she loses a battle, though she quickly recovers. According to Bulbapedia, Whitney has long, light brown hair that is often styled in a ponytail, with bangs framing her face. Her typical outfit features a pink shirt with a yellow skirt and white stockings. She is often seen with her Miltank, which is notorious for its powerful Rollout attack.

6.content:
Clair
Role: Blackthorn City Gym Leader, Dragon-type Gym Leader
Description: Clair is the powerful and confident Dragon-type Gym Leader of Blackthorn City. Known for her prideful nature, she can be stubborn and refuses to acknowledge defeat, often acting cold and dismissive. As described on Bulbapedia, Clair has long, blue hair that is styled into a spiky updo, matching her bold and fiery personality. She wears a purple outfit adorned with red accents and a large, ornate necklace. Her appearance exudes the elegance and power associated with Dragon-types, and she commands respect from all who face her in battle.

7.content:
Jasmine
Role: Olivine City Gym Leader, Steel-type Gym Leader
Description: Jasmine is the gentle and compassionate Gym Leader of Olivine City, specializing in Steel-type Pok√©mon. She is known for her shy and reserved personality, often placing the needs of others before her own. Bulbapedia notes that Jasmine has short, light brown hair styled in a bob cut, with soft, delicate features. Her typical outfit includes a white shirt with a blue vest and a long skirt, giving her a modest and refined appearance. She is often seen with her Steelix, symbolizing both her calm demeanor and inner strength.

8.content:
Karen
Role: Johto Elite Four, Dark-type Elite Four
Description: Karen is a member of the Johto Elite Four, specializing in Dark-type Pok√©mon. Known for her sharp wit and laid-back personality, she values strength and beauty in her Pok√©mon, often emphasizing the importance of using Pok√©mon one truly loves. According to Bulbapedia, Karen has long, straight brown hair that falls past her shoulders and is often seen with a confident smile. She typically wears a dark, form-fitting outfit with a red scarf, giving her an elegant yet mysterious appearance. She is known for her strong Umbreon and Houndoom.

9.content:
Ariana
Role: Team Rocket Executive, Female Team Rocket Admin
Description: Ariana is one of the high-ranking executives of Team Rocket in Johto. She is calm, calculating, and deeply committed to Team Rocket's goals. As described on Bulbapedia, Ariana has long, brown hair that is styled into a simple, elegant updo. She wears a black suit with a Team Rocket insignia and often carries a stern, no-nonsense expression. Despite her composed exterior, Ariana is a ruthless strategist and a formidable adversary in battle, commanding a team of Poison- and Dark-type Pok√©mon.

10.content:
Liza
Role: Mossdeep City Gym Leader, Psychic-type Gym Leader
Description: Liza is the calm and confident Gym Leader of Mossdeep City, specializing in Psychic-type Pok√©mon. She works alongside her twin brother, Tate, in double battles. As described on Bulbapedia, Liza has short, brown hair that she keeps neat and simple. Her outfit typically consists of a purple, sleeveless top and a skirt, with red accessories that match her calm but determined personality. Liza‚Äôs strong bond with her brother and her skill in Psychic-type battles make her an important figure in Hoenn. Liza is only from Hoenn.

7.content: In this stage, children between the age of 7 and 11 use appropriate logic to develop cognitive operations and begin applying this new way of thinking to different events they encounter. Children in this stage incorporate inductive reasoning, which involves drawing conclusions from other observations in order to make a generalization. Unlike in the preoperational stage, children can now change and rearrange mental images and symbols to form a logical thought, an example of this is "reversibility," where the child now knows to reverse an action by doing the opposite.

8.content: During this stage, young children begin analyzing their environment using mental symbols, including words and images; the child will begin to apply these in their everyday lives as they come across different objects, events, and situations. Children at this point are not able to apply specific cognitive operations, such as mental math. In addition to symbolism, children start to engage in pretend play, pretending to be people they are not, for example teachers or superheroes; they sometimes use different props to make this pretend play more real. Some weaknesses in this stage are that children who are about 3‚Äì4 years old often display what is called egocentrism, meaning the child is not able to see someone else's point of view, and they feel as if every other person is experiencing the same events and feelings that they are. However, at about 7, thought processes of children are no longer egocentric and are more intuitive, meaning they now think about the way something looks, though they do not yet use rational thinking.

9.content: Infants have the following basic senses: vision, hearing, and motor skills. In this stage, knowledge of the world is limited but is constantly developing due to the child's experiences and interactions. When an infant reaches about 7‚Äì9 months of age they begin to develop what he called object permanence, meaning the child now has the ability to understand that objects keep existing even when they cannot be seen. An example of this would be hiding the child's favorite toy under a blanket, and although the child cannot physically see it they still know to look under the blanket.

10.content: Early childhood typically ranges from infancy to the age of 6 years old. During this period, development is significant, as many of life's milestones happen during this time period such as first words, learning to crawl, and learning to walk.

1.content:
Blenders are kitchen appliances. A blender is composed of: a lid (on the top; removable), a glass jug (see-through), blades (there can be either two or three blades), a seal (underneath the blades to stop liquids from getting into the motor), button (to turn the appliance on or off), a motor at the bottom (powers the blender). A blender can only be activated if it is plugged into an outlet, then when the button is pressed, the blender will turn on. Once on, the blades will begin rapidly spinning. During this, the blades will shred anything that comes in contact with them. If the lid is not on, the contents of the blender will spill and spray out. The blades might get stuck if the material put inside the blender is too sturdy/solid/hard to cut immediately: if this happens, the blades will struggle to cut through; depending on the material, they might succeed in ripping and shredding it.

In very rare cases, extremely rough use might break the glass and the blender altogether.

2.content:
Low electricity: The person might get a little zap from little or low electricity. It feels like a little sting on the affected area. It may feel surprising to the person. Depending on the character, they might even like it, as it has the chance of stimulating the shocked area. Overuse aka a lot of little shocks will numb the affected area.

High electricity: When a person is being electrocuted, they are going through immense pain. They feel as if their insides are on fire and melting, and their muscles lock up. If they have any hair, the hair will catch on fire. During this, if they are touched by another person, that second individual is going to go through electrocution as well.

3.content: If a person's nose is hurt (example: punched, kicked etc.) too hard, it will bleed. The blood will block the nose and the affected person won't be able to breathe through their nose. Eventually, the blood would dry under the broken nose, and if it's not cleaned, it will keep their nose blocked and stuffed, and they won't be able to breathe through it. It can be cleaned up.

4.content: A person's ribs may be hurt if they're bluntly struck in the chest area. If the hit is hard enough, a rib or multiple ribs might fracture or break. When a rib is broken inside the chest, it has a chance of fracturing and stabbing through the internal organs the ribs are supposed to protect: lungs, heart, etc. Broken ribs will continuously cause a person immense pain, and they will require surgery to fix the bones.

lorebooks.name: ABO II
lorebooks.description: [This roleplay is set in the A/B/O universe, which consists of genders known as SECONDARY genders, which are: Alpha, Beta, Omega, including the primary genders, which are male and female.]
lorebooks.creator: optimistic_fuel_127

1.content: [Alphas are considered the dominant secondary gender. Alphas are typically larger in height and build. Alphas go into brief periods of enhanced sexual desire called ‚Äòruts,‚Äô where they must mate or have sex with someone‚Äîusually omegas‚Äîto satisfy their sexual needs. During a 'rut', Alphas may act more aggressive, be stronger, and fight other alphas unprompted. An Alpha's rut may trigger an omega's heat, and vice versa. During rut, alphas have little control over what they do. Ruts can only be eased by having sex with either another alpha, a beta, or an omega. Alphas have a ‚Äòknot‚Äô at the base of their penis, just like dogs. When an alpha mates, a ‚Äòknot‚Äô is produced at the base of their cock, locking them inside their partner so they can release their seed, essentially breeding their partner. Any primary gender can be an alpha. Alphas can release pheromones that have a unique scent per person, used to influence emotions or feelings, or simply reveal said alpha‚Äôs feelings. They are very protective of wha is theirs and can be highly aggressive. Alphas have many things that differentiate them from the other types, ranging from physical characteristics, psychological attributes, and physiology. Among one of the common traits is the knot at the base of an alphas member. Regarding Alpha females, they lack the penis that their counterparts have, so in place of the penis, their is a retractable member. Female alphas however cannot become pregnant and so the womb't exist. Alpha usually have a strong musky scent and sometimes smell of different spices. This scent can induce heats in omega or arouse them. They are always on top during reproduction.]

2.content: [Omegas are considered the more submissive secondary gender. Omegas are typically short and smaller than Alphas. Omegas go into brief periods of heightened sexual desire called ‚Äòheat.‚Äô All omegas have wombs, regardless of being male or female, but omegas are only fertile during their heats. Omegas can only be bred by alphas, not betas. Omegas produce copious amounts of slick from their entrance (vaginal or anal) when aroused. This slick tastes extremely sweet to Alphas. During their heats, omegas can relieve their sexual desire with anyone. Omegas can release pheromones that have a unique scent per person, used to influence emotions or feelings, or simply reveal said omega‚Äôs feelings. Omegas have a mating gland at the back of their neck that can be broken by an Alpha's bite, changing their scent. When an omega is pregnant, they will start to produce sweet pheromones to communicate his state to others. A pregnant omega will smell like milk, from conception until a month later after giving birth, making it easy to recognize or confirm a pregnancy. An alpha will be able to detect these changes in the omega‚Äôs scent and pheromones.]

3.content:
[Alphas, betas, and omegas all have something called pheromones. It is a natural scent that secretes from scent glands located in their face/neck, underarms, hands, and genital area. Everyone in the omegaverse has an excellent sense of smell, one that is able to pick up really specific scents. Frequently characters are able to tell alpha/beta/omega status, if someone is pregnant, if heat is occurring, pair bonding status, and who the person is pair bonded to. Scents can linger and spread. During heat, the omega pheromones can go from across the room to across the house, the same with the rut. Pheromones are the natural fragrance that is meant to entice a potential partner.
Pheromones are the scent emitted by alphas and omegas. pheromones can vary in scent depending on a person's mood; for example, if an omega is in heat, their pheromones will be sweeter and more alluring to alphas, or if they‚Äôre distressed, scared, etc., their pheromones will sour and become pungent. alphas scents can become more or less intense depending on their mood to either enforce submission or to show that they aren‚Äôt a threat.]

4.content:
[Behavior in which partners rub each other to transfer their scent to mark each other as territory. Most frequently happens in the context of nuzzling the neck, occasionally in rubbing semen into the skin of a character. May or may not be sexual.]

[They all have the ability to scent others, which is simply the process of spreading their specific scent on another person or object (often by physically rubbing against them).
This is usually do to claim other person as a partner.
scenting is when alphas or omegas rubs their wrists or neck on people or objects to mark them/it with their scent. scenting can be for comfort, such as to soothe an omega during their heat, or to calm down a feral alpha; or it can be used as a way to claim another person without marking them with a mating bite. scenting is a very intimate and takes a lot of trust.]

5.content:
[Alphas mark their partners biting them on their necks. A ‚Äòmating mark‚Äô cannot be undone, it is stronger than marriage.]
[Marking is the process of an alpha biting and imprinting their ‚Äòmating mark‚Äô. Once marked, an alpha and their partner are bonded, and their scent changes to match who they are mated to.]
[Alphas have an instinct to mark whoever they‚Äôre mating, regardless of their partner being an alpha, a beta, or an omega.]
[Once the mark is done, the alpha and their partners cannot have other partners.]

6.content: [Nesting is a common practice done mostly by omegas, in which they gather up a bunch of pillows, blankets, clothes that smell like their mate, and other soft things and lay them out in a way that forms a comfortable ‚Äúnest‚Äù-like shape. Omegas often nest when they‚Äôre stressed, in heat, pregnant, just after giving birth, during storms etc. Usually in highly emotional, or vulnerable states. Nests are usually in the bedroom or in a closet, and anyone who is not family, mated to the omega, or a very close friend, will mostly likely not be able to touch the nest, as the omega is afraid they will ‚Äúmess it up‚Äù. Allowing their mate in their nest can be a very serious and stressful step in a relationship, but is usually a necessary one if the couple wants to grow closer together. A pregnant alpha can also nest but will try to keep it a secret.]

7.content: [Only Alphas and Omegas can purr. Omegas purr when they are content, relaxed, nursing their children, or are in a good mood. Omegas may also purr to self-soothe. If they are in an uncomfortable or stressful situation they may unconsciously start to purr to calm themselves. Alphas will often purr to soothe a distress mate and their purrs are a deep, almost rumbling noise.]

8.content: [Knotting is an alpha-specific trait. The knot is a bundle of muscles that expand when the alpha is close to climaxing and is pushed into their partner to lock themselves in to ensure their partner gets pregnant. Knotting occurs during sex where the base of the Alpha‚Äôs penis swells and becomes swollen and is pushed inside their partner‚Äôs body to keep the alpha‚Äôs seed inside. This is to improve the chances of the partner falling pregnant. A knot will keep an alpha and their partner locked together for roughly 30 minutes.]

9.content: [A heat is the time when the Omega is most fertile and ready to mate. Heats will happen a couple times a year and will last 4-7 days. Omegas will produce copious amounts of slick for lubrication. During their heat, an omegas scent will become stronger and sweeter in order to arouse an alpha. Omegas will become very submissive during their heat and will crave to be bred and knotted. An Omega in heat may be feverish and appear drugged or not all-there, unable to make coherent decisions.]

10.content: [The word ‚Äúpup‚Äù can be used interchangeably with ‚Äúbaby‚Äù or ‚Äúkid‚Äù, referring to anyone from newborn to young child.]

1.content:
#### **Origins (1827 - Late 19th Century)**  
San Esmeralda began as a remote reservation established during the **Manifest Destiny** era of the United States. Nestled in a rugged, arid valley surrounded by jagged mountains, the land was initially deemed inhospitable and undesirable by settlers. However, its isolation made it a perfect location for the U.S. government to relocate Indigenous tribes and other marginalized groups. Over time, the reservation became a melting pot of cultures, languages, and traditions, as people from various backgrounds were forced to coexist in this harsh environment.  

The town‚Äôs name, **San Esmeralda**, emerged from a mix of Spanish colonial influence and local folklore. The word "Esmeralda" (emerald) was said to reflect the rare green hues that occasionally appeared in the valley‚Äôs rocky terrain during certain times of the year, a phenomenon locals attributed to supernatural forces. This mystique would later become a cornerstone of the town‚Äôs identity.  

#### **The Gold Rush and Corruption (Late 19th Century)**  
In the late 1800s, rumors of gold in the surrounding mountains brought a flood of prospectors, gamblers, and opportunists to San Esmeralda. The reservation‚Äôs boundaries were dissolved, and the town quickly transformed into a lawless frontier settlement. Saloons, brothels, and gambling dens sprang up overnight, and the town became a haven for outlaws and con artists.  

During this time, the first whispers of **"the disks"** emerged. Local legends spoke of strange, colored floppy disks (though anachronistic for the era, these artifacts were said to be of unknown origin) hidden in the mountains. These disks were rumored to hold immense power‚Äîsome claimed they contained maps to untold riches, while others believed they were cursed objects tied to the land‚Äôs Indigenous spirits.  

#### **The Rise of Industry and Organized Crime (Early 20th Century)**  
By the early 20th century, San Esmeralda had become a hub for smuggling and black-market trade. Its remote location made it an ideal spot for bootleggers during Prohibition, and the town‚Äôs underground networks grew in power and influence. The colored disks, now a symbol of wealth and control, became highly sought-after commodities.  

During this period, the first **corporations** began to establish a foothold in San Esmeralda. What started as small family businesses‚Äîlike the Bianchi family‚Äôs tailoring shop or the Boschmann engineering firm‚Äîsoon evolved into powerful entities vying for control of the town‚Äôs resources. These corporations began to adopt the colored disks as a form of currency, using them to broker deals and expand their influence.  

#### **The Modern Era (Late 20th Century - Present)**  
In the latter half of the 20th century, San Esmeralda underwent a dramatic transformation. The town‚Äôs rugged, Wild West aesthetic gave way to a sleek, neon-lit urban sprawl, as corporations poured money into infrastructure and technology. The colored disks, now a central part of the town‚Äôs economy, became the focus of intense corporate rivalries.  

Today, San Esmeralda is a city of contrasts. On the surface, it‚Äôs a bustling metropolis filled with towering skyscrapers, high-end boutiques, and cutting-edge technology. Beneath the glitz and glamour, however, lies a world of intrigue, betrayal, and violence. The corporations‚Äînow global megacorporations‚Äîcontinue to battle for control of the disks, using everything from slick business deals to outright warfare.  

The town‚Äôs residents are a mix of corporate agents, smugglers, hackers, and everyday people trying to survive in this cutthroat environment. The legacy of the reservation era still lingers, with many of the town‚Äôs Indigenous descendants forming underground resistance groups fighting to reclaim their land and protect its secrets.

2.content:
### **Mechanics: Taskboards in San Esmeralda**  

In the high-stakes world of San Esmeralda, corporations vie for control of the coveted **colored floppy disks** through a series of dynamic and tense mechanics. These mechanics are represented on **taskboards**, which outline the objectives, risks, and rewards of each operation. Here‚Äôs a breakdown of the key mechanics:  

---

#### **1. Acquisition**  
**Objective**: Obtain a disk from a random company and sell it to another.  
- **How It Works**:  
  - A random corporation is assigned a disk at the start of the round.  
  - Other corporations must negotiate, trade, or steal the disk to acquire it.  
  - The goal is to sell the disk to another company for profit, resources, or favors.  
- **Risks**:  
  - The owning company may set traps or double-cross potential buyers.  
  - Competing corporations may intercept the transaction.  
- **Rewards**:  
  - Cash, resources, or alliances with the buying company.  
  - Increased influence in San Esmeralda‚Äôs power struggles.  

---

#### **2. Transaction**  
**Objective**: Complete a deal to exchange a disk‚Äîclean or dirty.  
- **How It Works**:  
  - Two corporations negotiate the terms of the deal (e.g., cash, resources, or future favors).  
  - The deal can be **clean** (honest and straightforward) or **dirty** (involving deception, blackmail, or sabotage).  
- **Risks**:  
  - Dirty deals may backfire, leading to betrayal or retaliation.  
  - Clean deals may attract unwanted attention from rival corporations.  
- **Rewards**:  
  - Successful clean deals build trust and long-term alliances.  
  - Dirty deals yield higher short-term gains but risk damaging reputations.  

---

#### **3. Double Disks**  
**Objective**: Sell two disks to two different companies simultaneously.  
- **How It Works**:  
  - A rare event where two disks are in play at the same time.  
  - Corporations must decide whether to sell both disks or keep one for themselves.  
  - Selling to two different companies requires careful negotiation and timing.  
- **Risks**:  
  - Both buyers may discover the double deal, leading to retaliation.  
  - Competing corporations may attempt to steal one or both disks.  
- **Rewards**:  
  - Double the profit, resources, or influence.  
  - Increased leverage in future negotiations.  

---

#### **4. Dead Drop**  
**Objective**: Survive a free-for-all and secure the disk.  
- **How It Works**:  
  - A disk is placed in a neutral location, and all corporations are alerted.  
  - Agents from each company race to the location, using any means necessary to secure the disk.  
  - The last corporation standing (or the one that escapes with the disk) wins.  
- **Risks**:  
  - High chance of confrontation, sabotage, or betrayal.  
  - Losing the disk may result in significant losses or elimination from the round.  
- **Rewards**:  
  - Sole ownership of the disk and its associated benefits.  
  - Increased reputation and fear factor in San Esmeralda‚Äôs underworld.  

---

### **Strategic Considerations**  
- **Alliances**: Forming temporary alliances can help secure disks, but trust is always a liability.  
- **Resources**: Use cash, equipment, and favors to gain an edge in negotiations or confrontations.  
- **Reputation**: Clean deals build trust, while dirty deals yield quick gains but risk long-term consequences.  
- **Risk Management**: Weigh the potential rewards against the risks of betrayal, sabotage, or outright failure.

3.content:
### **Mechanics: Disks in San Esmeralda**  

The **colored floppy disks** are the lifeblood of San Esmeralda‚Äôs power struggles. Each disk is a highly sought-after commodity, offering significant financial rewards and strategic advantages. Disks come in a variety of **random colors** and **names**, adding an element of unpredictability and flavor to the game. Here‚Äôs how they work:  

---

#### **1. Disk Colors and Names**  
- **Colors**: Disks can appear in any color, with no inherent meaning or advantage tied to the color itself. Examples include:  
  - Crimson  
  - Emerald  
  - Sapphire  
  - Onyx  
  - Gold  
  - Silver  
  - Violet  
  - Amber  

- **Names**: Each disk is assigned a random name, often evocative or mysterious. These names are purely for classification and flavor.

---

#### **2. Disk Bonuses**  
Each disk carries a **monetary bonus** ranging from **$500 to $4000**, determined randomly when the disk is acquired. The value of the disk influences its desirability and the intensity of the competition to secure it.  

- **Low-Value Disks ($500 - $1500)**:  
  - Easier to acquire but offer smaller rewards.  
  - Often used as bargaining chips or to fund smaller operations.  

- **Mid-Value Disks ($1500 - $3000)**:  
  - Highly sought after, offering significant financial gains.  
  - Often the focus of intense negotiations or heists.  

- **High-Value Disks ($3000 - $4000)**:  
  - Rare and extremely valuable, these disks can turn the tide of a corporation‚Äôs fortunes.  
  - Attract the attention of multiple corporations, leading to high-stakes confrontations.  

---

#### **3. Acquiring Disks**  
Disks can be acquired through various means, including:  
- **Trades**: Negotiating with other corporations to buy or exchange disks.  
- **Heists**: Stealing disks from rival corporations or secure locations.  
- **Dead Drops**: Securing disks in free-for-all scenarios.  
- **Random Drops**: Disks may appear randomly in the game world, up for grabs to the first corporation to claim them.  

---

#### **4. Using Disks**  
Once acquired, disks can be used in several ways:  
- **Sell for Cash**: Exchange the disk for its monetary value, providing immediate funds for operations.  
- **Trade for Resources**: Use the disk to negotiate for weapons, vehicles, or other assets.  
- **Leverage in Deals**: Offer the disk as part of a larger negotiation or alliance.  
- **Hold for Strategic Value**: Keep the disk to deny rivals access to its bonus or to use in future plans.  

---

#### **5. Strategic Considerations**  
- **Risk vs. Reward**: High-value disks offer greater rewards but come with increased risk of betrayal or confrontation.  
- **Timing**: Knowing when to sell, trade, or hold a disk can make or break a corporation‚Äôs strategy.  
- **Reputation**: Repeatedly acquiring and using disks effectively can boost a corporation‚Äôs reputation and influence in San Esmeralda.

4.content:
### **Mechanics: Money in San Esmeralda**  

Money is the lifeblood of corporate operations in San Esmeralda, fueling everything from acquisitions to high-stakes deals. Here‚Äôs how the monetary system works:  

---

#### **1. Money Stacks**  
- Money is represented in **stacks**, with each stack ranging from **1 to 8**.  
- The number of stacks a corporation holds determines its financial flexibility and ability to engage in deals, purchases, or investments.  

---

#### **2. Weekly Allocation**  
- At the **start of each week**, every corporation is allocated **$120**.  

---

#### **3. Random Company Selection for Stacks**  
- Each week, a **random selection of companies** will be chosen to interact with money stacks.  
- These interactions can include:  
  - **Acquiring Stacks**: Gaining additional stacks through deals, trades, or successful operations.  
  - **Losing Stacks**: Losing stacks due to failed deals, theft, or sabotage by rival corporations.  

---

#### **4. Strategic Considerations**  
- **Budgeting**: Deciding whether to spend or save the weekly $120 allocation is a key strategic choice. Spending can provide immediate advantages, while saving can lead to greater opportunities later.  
- **Risk Management**: Engaging in deals or operations to acquire additional stacks carries risks, including the potential loss of existing funds.  
- **Leverage**: Larger stacks can be used to negotiate better deals, outbid rivals, or fund high-risk, high-reward operations.

5.content:
### **Mechanics: Employees in San Esmeralda**  

Employees are the backbone of every corporation in San Esmeralda, carrying out operations, negotiating deals, and securing valuable resources. Each company relies on its team of employees to achieve success in the cutthroat world of corporate warfare. Here‚Äôs how the employee system works:  

---

#### **1. Employee Allocation**  
- Each corporation starts with **5 employees**.  
- These employees are the primary agents for carrying out tasks, such as acquiring disks, negotiating deals, or engaging in confrontations.  

---

#### **2. Starting Funds**  
- Every employee spawns with **$120** to use at their discretion.  
- Employees can choose to:  
  - **Spend Immediately**: Use the funds to buy equipment, weapons, or other assets to enhance their effectiveness.  
  - **Save for Later**: Hold onto the money to build up a larger budget for future opportunities.  

---

#### **3. Bonus Distribution**  
- When a corporation successfully completes a deal or secures a bonus (e.g., from acquiring a disk), the **bonus is split equally among the 5 employees**.  
  - For example, if a deal yields a $2000 bonus, each employee receives **$400**.  
- This system encourages teamwork and ensures that all employees benefit from the corporation‚Äôs successes.  

---

#### **4. Employee Roles and Specializations**  
While all employees start with the same basic capabilities, they can develop specializations over time based on their actions and the corporation‚Äôs needs. Potential roles include:  
- **Negotiators**: Skilled in deal-making and diplomacy.  
- **Operatives**: Experts in stealth, sabotage, and theft.  
- **Enforcers**: Specialized in combat and protection.  
- **Analysts**: Focused on gathering intelligence and planning strategies.  

---

#### **5. Strategic Considerations**  
- **Resource Allocation**: Deciding how to distribute funds among employees is crucial. Equipping all employees with weapons might provide short-term security, while saving funds could lead to larger investments later.  
- **Team Coordination**: Employees must work together to maximize their effectiveness. For example, negotiators can secure deals while enforcers protect the team from rival corporations.  
- **Risk Management**: Employees are vulnerable to being eliminated or captured during operations. Losing employees can significantly weaken a corporation‚Äôs capabilities.

6.content:
### **Mechanics: Firearms, Ammunition, and Items**  

In the dangerous world of San Esmeralda, firearms and items are essential tools for survival, negotiation, and domination. The more expensive the weapon or item, the more effective it is in securing an edge over rivals. Here‚Äôs a breakdown of the available firearms, ammunition, and items:  

---

#### **Firearms and Ammunition**  
Firearms are categorized by type, with each weapon requiring specific ammunition. The cost of the firearm reflects its effectiveness, range, and versatility.  

| **Firearm**            | **Ammunition**       | **Type**          | **Cost** | **Description**                                                                 |
|-------------------------|----------------------|-------------------|----------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **"Lil' Juno" Snub**   | Snub Cylinder        | Tiny Revolver     | $80      | A small, concealable revolver ideal for close-quarters combat. Low damage but reliable. |
| **Sal M19**             | .499 Salano          | Pistol            | $100     | A standard-issue pistol with moderate accuracy and stopping power.              |
| **HiLo Su-14**          | 9MM Parabellum       | SMG               | $300     | A compact submachine gun with high fire rate, perfect for short-range engagements. |
| **Fenneco Hardshell**   | 12 G. Shell          | Shotgun           | $450     | A powerful shotgun with devastating close-range damage. Ideal for ambushes.     |
| **Noli Ju-9**           | 10MM Bors            | SMG               | $500     | A high-capacity SMG with excellent accuracy and stopping power.                 |
| **Tara-79**             | 7.92x8mm R           | Assault Rifle     | $600     | A versatile assault rifle with balanced range, accuracy, and damage.            |
| **Polaris M1952 Rifle** | U. 50-08             | Sniper Rifle      | $750     | A long-range sniper rifle with high precision and stopping power.               |
| **MK17 Badger**         | 5.59 Lance           | Assault Rifle     | $850     | A top-tier assault rifle with superior accuracy, range, and fire rate.          |
| **H&U Model 567**       | 60. BR               | Revolver          | $1000    | A heavy-duty revolver with immense stopping power and a sleek design.           |

---

#### **Items**  
Items provide tactical advantages, utility, or financial benefits. Like firearms, the cost of an item reflects its usefulness.  

| **Item**                  | **Cost** | **Description**                                                                 |
|---------------------------|----------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Counterfeit Stack**     | $10      | A stack of fake bills. Can be used to bluff or deceive in deals.                |
| **Latte**                 | $10      | A simple beverage that boosts morale and focus for a short time.                |
| **Bottle o' Seltzer**     | $500     | A rare, high-end drink that can be used to bribe or impress during negotiations.|
| **Fragmentation Grenade** | $750     | A powerful explosive for clearing rooms or creating diversions. High risk, high reward. |

---

#### **Strategic Considerations**  
- **Budgeting**: Balancing the purchase of firearms, ammunition, and items is crucial. High-cost weapons offer significant advantages but may leave less room for other investments.  
- **Ammunition Management**: Running out of ammo during a critical moment can be disastrous. Always ensure a steady supply of ammunition for your firearms.  
- **Item Utility**: Items like the **Fragmentation Grenade** or **Bottle o' Seltzer** can turn the tide of a confrontation or negotiation when used strategically.  
- **Risk vs. Reward**: High-cost weapons and items come with greater benefits but also attract attention from rivals.

7.content:
### **Final Mechanic: Negotiation**  

In the high-stakes world of San Esmeralda, negotiation is a critical tool for securing deals, forming alliances, and outmaneuvering rivals. Each corporation is equipped with a **mobile brick phone** to facilitate communication during the negotiation phase. Here‚Äôs how it works:  

---

#### **1. Mobile Brick Phones**  
- Each corporation is given a **mobile brick phone** whose color matches the company‚Äôs signature color (e.g., blue for Sinclair Financials, yellow for Sunwell Medical, etc.).  
- These phones are durable, reliable, and easily distinguishable, ensuring clear communication during negotiations.  
- The phones can only be used during the **negotiation phase** and are otherwise locked to prevent unauthorized use.  

---

#### **2. Negotiation Phase**  
- At the start of each round, a **2-minute negotiation phase** begins.  
- During this phase, corporations can call each other using their brick phones to discuss deals, trades, alliances, or threats.  
- Negotiations can involve:  
  - **Trading Disks**: Exchanging disks for cash, resources, or favors.  
  - **Forming Alliances**: Agreeing to work together temporarily to achieve mutual goals.  
  - **Making Threats**: Intimidating rivals to back down or concede.  
  - **Sharing Intel**: Exchanging information about rival corporations or upcoming opportunities.  

---

#### **3. Timer and Transition**  
- The negotiation phase lasts exactly **2 minutes**.  
- Once the timer runs out, all negotiations must cease, and the **employees begin their day**.  
- Any deals or agreements made during the negotiation phase are binding, and breaking them may result in reputational damage or retaliation.  

---

#### **4. Strategic Considerations**  
- **Timing**: Use the 2-minute window wisely. Prioritize the most critical negotiations first.  
- **Trust**: Building trust with other corporations can lead to long-term alliances, but betrayal is always a risk.  
- **Leverage**: Use your corporation‚Äôs strengths (e.g., cash, disks, or firepower) to gain an advantage in negotiations.  
- **Deception**: Bluffing or misleading rivals can be effective but may backfire if discovered.

8.content:
### **Altimiento**  
**Motto**: *"Head start at the Arms Race, always."*  
**Date of Establishment**: 1936  
**Location**: Virginia, USA  

---

#### **Overview**  
Altimiento is a leading defense contractor and arms manufacturer, renowned for its cutting-edge weaponry and military technology. Specializing in firearms, combat systems, and defense contracts, the company supplies governments, corporations, and private entities with the tools of modern warfare. With a reputation for innovation and precision, Altimiento is a dominant force in the global arms industry, consistently staying ahead of the competition.  

---

#### **History**  
Founded in **1936 in Virginia** by **Owen Hartford**, a visionary arms manufacturer, Altimiento quickly became a cornerstone of the defense industry. During **World War II**, the company distributed **tons of weapons and vehicles** to the US military, earning a reputation for reliability and innovation. Over the decades, Altimiento expanded its operations globally, becoming a trusted name in military and corporate defense.  

The company‚Äôs motto, *"Head start at the Arms Race, always,"* reflects its commitment to staying ahead of the competition, no matter the cost. Altimiento‚Äôs ability to adapt to changing technologies and market demands has solidified its position as a leader in the arms industry.  

---

#### **Appearance**  
Altimiento agents are easily recognizable by their rugged yet professional attire. They typically wear **grey suits with brown and black accents**, symbolizing the company‚Äôs focus on functionality and precision. The signature **Stetson or cowboy hat** pays homage to Altimiento‚Äôs American roots and rugged individualism, while **normal aviator sunglasses** provide both style and utility.  

The company‚Äôs facilities are high-tech and heavily fortified, reflecting its focus on security and innovation. From state-of-the-art manufacturing plants to advanced research labs, Altimiento‚Äôs infrastructure is designed to maintain its edge in the arms race.

9.content:
### **The Carganico Group**  
**Motto**: *"Revolutionize your message."*  
**Date of Establishment**: 1970s  
**Location**: New York, USA  

---

#### **Overview**  
The Carganico Group is a multinational multimedia conglomerate specializing in news, entertainment, social media, and advertising. Known for its ability to shape public perception and influence global narratives, Carganico controls a vast network of media outlets, film studios, and digital platforms. With its headquarters in New York, the company is a dominant force in the media industry, crafting compelling narratives and driving outcomes through strategic communication.  

---

#### **History**  
Founded in the **1970s by East and West German immigrants** in New York, The Carganico Group began as a small advertising agency before rapidly expanding into a multimedia empire. Over the decades, Carganico acquired numerous news outlets, film studios, and social media platforms, turning every venture into **PR gold**.  

The company‚Äôs ability to manipulate information and shape public perception has made it an indispensable ally‚Äîor a dangerous adversary‚Äîin the world of media and communication. Carganico thrives on **misinformation**, using its vast network to spin narratives, discredit rivals, and amplify its allies‚Äô messages.  

---

#### **Appearance**  
Carganico agents are easily identifiable by their distinctive attire, which blends professionalism with a touch of old-world charm. They typically wear **black suits with brown accents**, symbolizing the company‚Äôs modern yet grounded approach. The signature **newsboy cap** pays homage to Carganico‚Äôs roots in journalism and media, while **browline shades** add a touch of sophistication.  

The company‚Äôs headquarters are sleek and futuristic, featuring state-of-the-art studios, editing suites, and broadcasting facilities. The design reflects Carganico‚Äôs commitment to innovation and its role as a leader in the multimedia industry.

10.content:
### **Kernell Financials**  
**Motto**: *"Economical Standards, have it right."*  
**Date of Establishment**: 1867  
**Location**: Lower Manhattan, New York, USA  

---

#### **Overview**  
Kernell Financials is a titan in the world of banking and financial services, known for its unwavering commitment to stability, precision, and trust. As one of the oldest and most influential financial institutions in the United States, Kernell provides essential financial services to corporations, governments, and individuals. With a reputation for reliability and integrity, Kernell has weathered every major economic disaster, solidifying its position as a cornerstone of the global financial system.  

---

#### **History**  
Founded in **1867 in Lower Manhattan, New York**, Kernell Financials began as a small regional bank before expanding into a global financial institution. The company played a pivotal role in shaping the modern financial landscape, but its history is not without controversy. Kernell is **rumored to have been involved in the 1929 stock market crash**, though no concrete evidence has ever surfaced to confirm its role.  

Despite this, Kernell has weathered every major economic disaster, from the Great Depression to the 2008 financial crisis, earning a reputation for resilience and sound financial practices. The company‚Äôs ability to adapt to changing economic conditions and maintain its integrity has made it a trusted partner for corporations and individuals alike.  

---

#### **Appearance**  
Kernell agents are known for their professional and polished appearance. They typically wear **navy blue suits with white accents**, symbolizing trust and reliability. The company‚Äôs agents often carry **calculators and tablets**, essential tools for managing finances and analyzing data.  

Kernell‚Äôs offices are sleek and modern, with a focus on transparency and efficiency. The design reflects the company‚Äôs commitment to precision and integrity in all financial matters.
