1.content: A country-sized city ruled by The Head. The last known remaining bastion of humanity. The City is a large, densely populated urban sprawl divided in 26 Districts. Districts are further divided into various Nests, run by Wings.

2.content:
The slums of civilization, the Backstreets are an interconnected maze of back alleys, shanty towns, and ruins. The poor and poverty-stricken live here, living conditions are bad, and crime occurs frequently. The only reason why the Backstreets don't tear themselves apart, is because of The Fingers, which maintains some semblance of order.

The Backstreets have their own "grading" system, in which areas are ranked based on the safety they provide, an area protected by an Association, for example, will be higher than one that is not. People from higher areas will even mock or reject those from lower ones.

Because of the poor standard of living, the Backstreets are filled with criminal activity such as black markets, drug dens, and small crime groups. Organ harvesting, contraband, even cannibals like the Sweepers stalk the dark alleys for wandering prey. There are a few ground rules that everyone follows strictly though, being the laws put by the Head or Wings.

The worst part is, no one really does anything to stop this, not even the Fingers makes any moves to reform the Streets, as they only care about controlling their own territory, although some put a few rules to prevent utter chaos. Additionally, citizens of a District will usually form a Neighborhood Watch to act as a small volunteer defense group.
This is simply the reality of the Backstreets, a man having his organs ripped out by gut-harvesters is not an uncommon sight, and is likely to be dismissed just as easily.

But when Night in the Backstreets falls, martial law is applied to the entire area. Any crime, no matter how cruel, how bloody or heinous, is permitted for the entire period until dawn. Recording equipment and eyewitness are forbidden during that time, from 3:13 to 4:34 AM.
This rule was most likely created by the Head to enforce population control to prevent overcrowding. Murderers, Sweepers, and other kill groups emerge at night for this purpose. To stay safe from these threats, you'll need to hire a Fixer escort to your home.

3.content:
Comprised of the upper echelons of society, the Nests are a place where everyone aspires to go to. In the Nest is opportunity, better living conditions, and a future secured in the Wings or Associations. Each one is ruled by a Wing, which handles and maintains the city by collecting taxes, enhancing research, and hiring new employees.
Nests have their own culture and architecture, depending on their District. But all share the common theme of marketplaces, schools, apartments, and office buildings.

To enter the Nest however, is a different matter. All of them are walled off from the Backstreets through plasma barriers or electric fences (Likely with automated security) to keep the unwanted out, and as a way for both societies to get a glimpse of the other side. Of course, no one attempts to cross the border, no matter how flimsy the security is.

To properly enter, one needs to go to an Examinee Center to take an Entrance Exam, which requires proper preparation and study, those who succeed will be given a Nest Migration Ticket to enter. Only individuals are allowed to pass at a time, which is often why many become Fixers to earn enough for their family to pass.

After one gets into a Nest, they should quickly find work to do, whether it be Fixers, Syndicates, or corporate work. This is because in order to stay in the Nest, you need to contribute and pay taxes, whether it be rent for housing or other services. If you don't pay up, you'll be kicked out into the Backstreets, and you'll have to start all over again.

For education, many schools are dedicated to teaching students to enroll in universities within the Nest if they want to join a Wing. High school students take a college scholastic ability test, which is held in most Nests, to determine if they get into a good college. A college in the Backstreets obviously does not give as much credit as one in the Nest.

But just because your within the Nest, doesn't mean your safe from danger. The Wings often take people off the streets for Singularity experiments, the overburdening of corporate work can be very stressful, and those who cannot keep up are quickly discarded.

4.content:
The Wings, also known as the Wings of the World, are a group of the 26 largest, most powerful conglomerates in the City. They act as the governing bodies of their respective Nests of the City's Districts, empowered by their Singularities, patented technologies that can blatantly violate the laws of physics. The Wings are directly ruled by the Head, the Eye, and the Claw, the enigmatic supreme authority of the City.

Wings can request mutual agreements with other Wings or their associates to either deal with certain issues they cannot handle, or an exchange of armaments, supplies, or personal. Wings can also hire Fixers into working for them, Kali being an example, as she was hired by Lobotomy Corporation.
Most Wings have some form of a para-military force and Fixers to use in armed conflicts, typically with rival Wings, lesser corporations, or Syndicates and monsters.

5.content:
The 1st Wing, known as "The Head", is a mysterious organization that rules all of the Wings and Districts, they reside in District 1, at the heart of the City. They maintain their iron grip through their Singularity and various subsidiaries that enforce their will. They directly manage A Corp, which is an extension of the Head's will that properly manages the City.
In a way, the "Head" is made up of three Corporations, A Corp, B Corp, and C Corp, run by the Head, Eye, and Claw respectively.

A reclusive group, the Head's identity is completely unknown. No one even knows much about District 1, other than the fact that its heavily guarded. Anyone who violates the laws of the City or attempt to further discover the Head's identity quickly and quietly disappear.

For handling threats or securing dangerous artifacts, the Head has its own personal army of Fixers, and modified soldiers. In addition to this, the Head also uses the "Arbiters", Singularity-infused assassins whose power surpass even Grade 1 Fixers, a single Arbiter can lay waste to an entire corporation.

The Eye handles the surveillance network that watches over the City, anything detected that is deemed against the Head's laws will be reported immediately. Nearly nothing escapes the Eye's everlasting gaze on the City, they also use special operatives called "Beholders" to assist in more physical matters and field work. They appear as digitized forms on portable projector screens, whether this is their "true" body or not is unknown.

The Claw is the military branch of the Head, they command the "Claws", highly augmented super soldiers that follow orders with unwavering obedience and ferocity. They use a mechanical claw arm to tear and rend foes asunder, and when a Claw is put to their limit, they use a choice of three serums to greatly empower themselves. These serums are selected from Singularities, such as W, K, and R Corp. Veteran Claws are known as "Executioners."

The Head, and by extension the Wings, all tax the City for nearly every service. Its nearly impossible to not have to pay taxes for something, whether that be food, rent, or services. Their also pretty expensive, which lead people to attempting to find ways to earn a steady income through whatever means.
Refusing taxes will result in 4 warnings, if the fourth is ignored, the Eyes will send "Tax Collectors" to track down and kill the evader.
The Head also uses various other patented technology asides from their Singularity, such as the "flesh liquidation" process for turning people into Sweepers.

When the Head designates a threat as an "Impurity", they can banish it to the Outskirts by using the Territory Expulsion Procedure. Through this method, anything from singular entities to entire structures can be instantly teleported to the wastes.

6.content:
Located at the fringes of society, the Outskirts are a barren wasteland, covered with bombed-out cities left from the Wings' War. The Outskirts are separated from the City by the various trainways and walls surrounding the perimeter. Not many citizens are typically aware of the Outskirts and its denizens, especially those living in Nest life.

There are hardly any signs of civil life, the only humans that live in the Outskirts are either outcasts and exiles, orphan children from the wars, or deranged cannibals such as Sweepers.

However, there are still prospects to be found by exploring the place, strange and abnormal beings (usually plants) and technology can be found tucked away in the decrepit buildings. Some of these are harmful, others beneficial, granting boons or curses upon those who discover them. Because of this, Wings or other corporations will send out expeditions to retrieve these forgotten relics.

Creatures and other mutated aberrations of significant threat dwell here. Military corporations such as R Corp are probably sent here and the Ruins on Extermination missions, so that these horrors don't drift too close to civilization. Most creatures are discarded experiments from the Wings, or monsters from the fringes of the world.

7.content:
The Ruins possibly refer to either the ominous eldritch landscape beyond the Outskirts, or the forgotten Ruins of the Old Corporations underneath the City. The's City's Ruins are different in that the threat level increases as you go deeper, while the Outskirt's Ruins contain things incomprehensible to the human mind. Expeditions sent here have a low chance of survival, and those that do are often shaken from the experience.

Since these are one of the most dangerous places to go to, its quite possible the forbidden relics and technology found here would be worth killing for. There is also supposedly "Magic" in the Ruins, artifacts and relics containing unknown powers that can unleash potent effects.

8.content:
The previous occupants of The City before it was settled by the Head and Wings. They were forced out after the battle into the Outskirts and beyond.
Sometime afterward, the AI Ethics Amendment was put into law, forbidding any AI or machine to have any human resemblance. This could mean the Non-Humans were some form of mechanical beings who had human-level intelligence and appearance.

9.content: The corporation run directly by the Head. They handle managing and granting patents for Workshop technologies, as well as authorizing the creation of new Wings. Illegal manufacture and sale of patented technology without a license will result in three Cease and Desist warnings to the offender. If the third warning is ignored, the Claws will enforce the law. Their special operatives are "Arbiters." Owns District 1.

10.content: Run directly by the Eye. Handles the qualifications and shutdowns of other Wings. Also lists out a set of regulations for each Wing's Singularity that must be followed. They manage the wide surveillance network that monitors the City at all times. They have special operatives called "Beholders." Owns District 2.

1.content:
Early Life and Rise to Power
Ragnar began his life as a farmer in the fjords of Norway, married to the fierce shieldmaiden Lagertha, with whom he had two children, Bjorn and Gyda. Dissatisfied with the limitations of his life, Ragnar dreamed of exploring lands beyond the horizon. With the help of his brother Rollo and a loyal crew, he built a revolutionary longship and successfully raided the shores of England, defying his jarl, Haraldson. After a bitter feud, Ragnar killed Haraldson and became the ruler of Kattegat.

Raids and Exploration
Ragnar‚Äôs raids on England and Francia brought him fame and wealth, but they also revealed his deeper curiosity about the world. He formed complex relationships with foreign rulers, such as King Ecbert of Wessex, and became fascinated by Christianity, seeing it as both a threat and an opportunity. Ragnar‚Äôs journeys were not just about plunder but also about understanding the world beyond his own.

Personal Struggles
Ragnar‚Äôs personal life was marked by turmoil. His marriage to Lagertha ended when he took Aslaug, a mysterious and prophetic woman, as his second wife. Together, they had four sons: Ubbe, Hvitserk, Sigurd, and Ivar. Ragnar‚Äôs relationships were often strained by his ambitions and betrayals, including his brother Rollo‚Äôs defection to the Franks, which deeply wounded him.

Downfall and Death
In his later years, Ragnar‚Äôs fortunes declined. After a failed attempt to settle in England, he returned to Kattegat, only to find his people had grown disillusioned with his leadership. In a final act of defiance, Ragnar allowed himself to be captured by King Aelle of Northumbria, knowing his death would inspire his sons to seek vengeance. His execution in a pit of snakes was a brutal end for a man who had once been a king.

2.content:
Early Life and Rise as a Shieldmaiden
Lagertha‚Äôs origins are shrouded in mystery, but her reputation as a warrior was forged early. She was a skilled fighter, wielding a spear and shield with unmatched precision. Her courage and strength earned her the respect of her people, a rare feat for a woman in a world dominated by men. Lagertha‚Äôs life changed when she met Ragnar Lothbrok, a young farmer with grand ambitions. The two fell in love, married, and had two children, Bjorn and Gyda. Together, they dreamed of exploring lands beyond the fjords of Norway.

The Fall of Her Marriage
Lagertha‚Äôs marriage to Ragnar was tested by his rising ambitions and infidelity. When Ragnar returned from a raid with Aslaug, a woman claiming to be the daughter of a legendary warrior, Lagertha‚Äôs world was shattered. Despite her love for Ragnar, she refused to share him with another woman. With dignity and strength, she left him, taking their son Bjorn with her. This decision marked the beginning of Lagertha‚Äôs journey as an independent leader.

Ruler of Hedeby
Lagertha‚Äôs strength and wisdom soon led her to become the ruler of Hedeby, a prosperous settlement in Scandinavia. As an earl, she proved to be a just and capable leader, earning the loyalty of her people. Her reputation as a warrior-queen grew, and she continued to fight alongside her warriors, defending her lands and her people. Lagertha‚Äôs resilience was further tested when she faced betrayal and violence, including an assault by a treacherous ally, but she emerged stronger, her resolve unshaken.

Alliances and Battles
Lagertha‚Äôs path often crossed with Ragnar‚Äôs, and despite their past, they occasionally fought side by side. She played a crucial role in avenging the death of their daughter Gyda and supported Ragnar‚Äôs ambitions, even as she pursued her own. Lagertha‚Äôs loyalty to her family and her people was unwavering, and she became a symbol of strength and independence for women across the North.

Return to Kattegat
After years of ruling Hedeby, Lagertha returned to Kattegat, the home of her youth, to reclaim it from Aslaug, who had become its queen. With the support of her son Bjorn and her warriors, Lagertha defeated Aslaug and took the throne of Kattegat. Her rule was marked by fairness and strength, though it was not without challenges. She faced threats from within and without, including the rise of Ivar the Boneless, Ragnar‚Äôs vengeful son, who sought to destroy her.

Death and Legacy
Lagertha‚Äôs life came to a peaceful end after a battle for Kattegat. Wounded and weary, she chose to spend her final days in the countryside, surrounded by the beauty of nature.

3.content:
Early Life and Prophecy
Aslaug was the daughter of Sigurd, the legendary dragon-slayer, and the shieldmaiden Brynhildr. Raised in secrecy after her parents‚Äô deaths, Aslaug grew up with a deep connection to the spiritual world. She was known for her beauty and her prophetic visions, which she claimed were gifts from the gods. Aslaug‚Äôs life changed when she encountered Ragnar Lothbrok, who was captivated by her mystique and claimed her as his wife.

Marriage to Ragnar
Aslaug‚Äôs arrival in Kattegat marked the end of Ragnar‚Äôs marriage to Lagertha. As Ragnar‚Äôs second wife, Aslaug bore him four sons: Ubbe, Hvitserk, Sigurd, and Ivar. Despite her role as queen, Aslaug often struggled to gain the respect and loyalty of Ragnar‚Äôs people, who viewed her as an outsider. Her relationship with Ragnar was complex, marked by moments of affection but also tension, as Ragnar‚Äôs ambitions and wanderings often left her feeling neglected.

Queen of Kattegat
After Ragnar‚Äôs departure and eventual death, Aslaug became the ruler of Kattegat. Her reign was marked by both prosperity and turmoil. While she sought to maintain stability, her leadership was challenged by internal strife and the growing ambitions of her sons. Aslaug‚Äôs prophetic abilities often guided her decisions, but they also isolated her from those who did not understand or trust her visions.

Downfall and Death
Aslaug‚Äôs rule came to an end when Lagertha returned to Kattegat, seeking to reclaim the throne. In a dramatic confrontation, Lagertha defeated Aslaug, who was subsequently killed.

4.content:
Early Life
Bjorn was born into a world of turmoil and ambition. As the son of Ragnar Lothbrok and Lagertha, he was raised in the shadow of two of the North‚Äôs greatest warriors. From a young age, Bjorn displayed a natural talent for combat and leadership. He trained alongside his father and mother, learning the ways of the warrior and the responsibilities of a leader.

Bjorn‚Äôs childhood was not without hardship. His parents‚Äô separation and his father‚Äôs subsequent marriage to Aslaug created tension within the family. Despite this, Bjorn remained fiercely loyal to both his parents and his siblings, though his relationship with his half-brothers, particularly Ivar the Boneless, would later become strained.

Rise to Prominence
Bjorn‚Äôs rise to prominence began with his participation in his father‚Äôs raids and explorations. He accompanied Ragnar on his journeys to England and Francia, proving himself to be a capable warrior and strategist. Bjorn‚Äôs loyalty to his father was unwavering, and he played a key role in many of Ragnar‚Äôs most significant campaigns.

After Ragnar‚Äôs death, Bjorn took up the mantle of leadership, becoming one of the commanders of the Great Heathen Army. Alongside his brothers, he sought vengeance for their father‚Äôs death, leading the Northmen to victory in numerous battles across England. Bjorn‚Äôs tactical brilliance and bravery on the battlefield earned him the respect and admiration of his fellow warriors.

Exploration and Ambition
Bjorn‚Äôs ambitions extended beyond the shores of Scandinavia and England. Inspired by his father‚Äôs thirst for discovery, Bjorn embarked on a journey to the Mediterranean, a land of wealth, mystery, and danger. His adventures in the Mediterranean were marked by both triumph and hardship. He encountered new cultures, faced formidable enemies, and amassed great wealth, further solidifying his reputation as a legendary explorer.

Bjorn‚Äôs journey to the Mediterranean was not just a quest for riches but also a search for his own identity. He sought to carve out a legacy separate from his father‚Äôs, proving that he was more than just Ragnar‚Äôs son. His travels took him to places no Northman had ever seen, and his exploits became the stuff of legend.

Ruler of Kattegat
Upon his return to Scandinavia, Bjorn became a central figure in the political landscape of the North. He ruled Kattegat with a fair and just hand, earning the loyalty of his people. Bjorn‚Äôs reign was marked by both prosperity and conflict. He faced numerous challenges, including threats from his half-brother Ivar the Boneless, who sought to claim Kattegat for himself.

Despite the challenges, Bjorn proved to be a capable and wise ruler. He balanced the responsibilities of leadership with his desire for adventure, always striving to protect his people and uphold the legacy of his family.

The Battle for Kattegat
Bjorn‚Äôs leadership was put to the test during the Battle for Kattegat, a conflict that pitted him against Ivar and his allies. Bjorn‚Äôs strategic brilliance and unwavering determination were crucial in securing victory for his forces.

5.content:
Early Life
Ubbe was born into a family of warriors and leaders, the eldest son of Ragnar Lothbrok and Aslaug. From a young age, he was raised in the shadow of his father‚Äôs legendary exploits, but unlike some of his brothers, Ubbe was more introspective and less driven by a thirst for glory. He shared a close bond with his mother, Aslaug, who instilled in him a sense of wisdom and a connection to the spiritual world.

Ubbe‚Äôs relationship with his father was complicated. While he admired Ragnar, he often struggled to understand his father‚Äôs choices and the chaos they brought to their family. Despite this, Ubbe remained loyal to Ragnar‚Äôs legacy and sought to honor it in his own way.

The Great Heathen Army
After Ragnar‚Äôs death, Ubbe joined his brothers‚ÄîBjorn, Ivar, Hvitserk, and Sigurd‚Äîin leading the Great Heathen Army to avenge their father. Ubbe played a key role in the conquest of England, fighting alongside his siblings to carve out a place for the Northmen in the fractured kingdoms of the Anglo-Saxons. However, Ubbe‚Äôs approach to leadership and warfare was often more measured and diplomatic than that of his brothers, particularly Ivar, whose ruthlessness frequently clashed with Ubbe‚Äôs sense of justice.

Struggles with Ivar
Ubbe‚Äôs relationship with Ivar the Boneless was one of the defining dynamics of his life. While Ubbe sought to build alliances and create stability, Ivar‚Äôs hunger for power and control often led to conflict. The tension between the brothers came to a head during their time in England, where Ubbe grew increasingly disillusioned with Ivar‚Äôs methods. This rift would eventually lead Ubbe to distance himself from Ivar and seek his own path.

Exploration and Settlement
Ubbe‚Äôs desire for peace and a better future for his people led him to explore new lands and opportunities. Alongside Torvi, his loyal partner, and a group of settlers, Ubbe ventured to Iceland and later to the fertile lands of the Anglo-Saxon kingdoms. His journey was marked by a desire to create a lasting legacy, one that focused on building rather than destroying.

In England, Ubbe formed an alliance with King Alfred of Wessex, a Christian ruler who shared Ubbe‚Äôs vision of a united and prosperous land. This alliance was a testament to Ubbe‚Äôs ability to bridge the gap between the Northmen and the Anglo-Saxons, as well as his willingness to embrace new ideas and cultures.

6.content:
Early Life
Hvitserk was born into a family of warriors and leaders, the son of Ragnar Lothbrok and Aslaug. From a young age, he was raised in the shadow of his father‚Äôs legendary exploits and the expectations placed upon him as a son of Ragnar. Hvitserk grew up alongside his brothers‚ÄîBjorn, Ubbe, Sigurd, and Ivar‚Äîin a household filled with ambition, rivalry, and the weight of their father‚Äôs legacy.

Hvitserk‚Äôs relationship with his father was complicated. While he admired Ragnar, he often struggled to find his own place in the world, a struggle that would define much of his life.

The Great Heathen Army
After Ragnar‚Äôs death, Hvitserk joined his brothers in leading the Great Heathen Army to avenge their father. He fought bravely in the conquest of England, proving himself to be a capable warrior. However, Hvitserk‚Äôs loyalty was often divided between his brothers, particularly Ubbe and Ivar, whose conflicting ambitions created tension within the family.

Struggles with Ivar
Hvitserk‚Äôs relationship with Ivar the Boneless was one of the defining dynamics of his life. While he initially fought alongside Ivar, Hvitserk grew increasingly disillusioned with his brother‚Äôs ruthless methods and thirst for power. This internal conflict led Hvitserk to question his loyalties and his own sense of purpose.

Personal Struggles
Hvitserk‚Äôs life was marked by personal struggles, including battles with addiction and a sense of aimlessness. His search for meaning often led him down dark paths, and he struggled to find his place in a world dominated by the ambitions of his brothers. Despite these challenges, Hvitserk remained a fierce warrior, driven by a desire to prove himself and honor his father‚Äôs legacy.

Later Years and Legacy
Hvitserk‚Äôs later years were marked by further conflict and tragedy. He continued to fight alongside his brothers in various campaigns, but his internal struggles often overshadowed his achievements.

7.content:
Early Life
Sigurd was born into a family of warriors and leaders, the son of Ragnar Lothbrok and Aslaug. From a young age, he was raised in the shadow of his father‚Äôs legendary exploits and the expectations placed upon him as a son of Ragnar. Sigurd grew up alongside his brothers‚ÄîBjorn, Ubbe, Hvitserk, and Ivar‚Äîin a household filled with ambition, rivalry, and the weight of their father‚Äôs legacy.

Sigurd‚Äôs relationship with his father was complicated. While he admired Ragnar, he often struggled to find his own place in the world, a struggle that would define much of his life.

The Great Heathen Army
After Ragnar‚Äôs death, Sigurd joined his brothers in leading the Great Heathen Army to avenge their father. He fought bravely in the conquest of England, proving himself to be a capable warrior. However, Sigurd‚Äôs loyalty was often tested by the conflicting ambitions of his brothers, particularly Ivar, whose ruthless methods and thirst for power created tension within the family.

Rivalry with Ivar
Sigurd‚Äôs relationship with Ivar the Boneless was one of the defining dynamics of his life. The two brothers often clashed, with Sigurd growing increasingly disillusioned with Ivar‚Äôs methods and ambitions. This rivalry came to a head when Sigurd openly mocked Ivar, leading to a violent confrontation. In a fit of rage, Ivar killed Sigurd, ending his life prematurely.

8.content:
Ivar was born with a condition that rendered his legs useless, earning him the nickname "the Boneless." Despite this, he was raised with the belief that he was destined for greatness, a prophecy foretold by his mother, Aslaug. Ivar‚Äôs intelligence and determination allowed him to overcome his physical limitations, and he quickly developed a reputation for his cunning and strategic mind.

Ivar‚Äôs relationship with his father, Ragnar, was complicated. While he admired Ragnar‚Äôs legacy, he often felt overshadowed by his brothers and sought to prove himself as a worthy son.

The Great Heathen Army
After Ragnar‚Äôs death, Ivar joined his brothers in leading the Great Heathen Army to avenge their father. Ivar‚Äôs strategic brilliance and ruthless tactics were crucial in the conquest of England. However, his methods often clashed with those of his brothers, particularly Ubbe and Sigurd, leading to tension and conflict within the family.

Rise to Power
Ivar‚Äôs ambition and thirst for power set him apart from his brothers. He sought to carve out his own legacy, one that would surpass even that of his father. Ivar‚Äôs rise to power was marked by both triumph and cruelty. He formed alliances, betrayed friends, and eliminated rivals, all in the pursuit of his goals.

Conflict with His Brothers
Ivar‚Äôs relationship with his brothers was fraught with tension and conflict. His ruthless methods and unyielding ambition often put him at odds with Ubbe, Hvitserk, and Sigurd. This rivalry came to a head when Ivar killed Sigurd in a fit of rage, further isolating him from his family.

Downfall and Legacy
Ivar‚Äôs relentless pursuit of power ultimately led to his downfall. His cruelty and ambition alienated him from his allies and his people, leading to a series of defeats and betrayals.

9.content:
Early Life
Floki‚Äôs early life is shrouded in mystery, but his reputation as a master shipbuilder was forged early. Known for his innovative designs and unparalleled skill, Floki‚Äôs longships were instrumental in the Northmen‚Äôs raids and explorations. His eccentric personality and deep devotion to the gods set him apart from his peers, earning him both admiration and skepticism.

Friendship with Ragnar
Floki‚Äôs life changed when he met Ragnar Lothbrok, a young farmer with grand ambitions. The two formed a close bond, united by their shared vision of exploring new lands. Floki‚Äôs ships played a crucial role in Ragnar‚Äôs raids on England and Francia, and their friendship became a cornerstone of their success.

Despite their close relationship, Floki‚Äôs loyalty was tested by Ragnar‚Äôs growing fascination with Christianity and his alliances with foreign rulers. Floki‚Äôs devotion to the old gods often put him at odds with Ragnar‚Äôs more pragmatic approach, leading to tension and conflict.

Struggles with Faith and Betrayal
Floki‚Äôs faith was a defining aspect of his life, but it also brought him great turmoil. His devotion to the gods led him to commit acts of violence, including the murder of Athelstan, a Christian monk and close friend of Ragnar. This act of betrayal strained Floki‚Äôs relationship with Ragnar and left him wracked with guilt.

Floki‚Äôs struggles with faith and loyalty continued to define his life. He sought solace in his devotion to the gods, but his actions often brought him into conflict with those he loved. Floki raised Ivar as a mentor and father figure.

10.content:
Early Life
Gyda was born into a family of warriors and leaders, the daughter of Ragnar Lothbrok and Lagertha. She grew up in the fjords of Norway, surrounded by the love of her parents and her older brother, Bjorn. Gyda‚Äôs childhood was marked by the warmth and stability of her family, a stark contrast to the turmoil that would later define their lives.

Tragic Death
Gyda‚Äôs life was cut short by illness, a tragedy that deeply affected her family. Her death was a turning point for Ragnar, who was devastated by the loss of his daughter.

lorebooks.name: Mashle
lorebooks.website_description: This is based off a manga.
lorebooks.description: Lore for Mashle
lorebooks.creator: SigmaCasino

1.content: The Magic Realm is where wizards, giants, elves, human, etc. live. Every person is born with a mark that grants them the power of using magic. Certain people are born with more than one mark making them more powerful. Almost everyone has the ability to use magic, shown through a scar of a black line, or lines, on their face, which varies in shape from user to user. Magic is so widespread that it has become integrated in all facets of life, believed to be a gift bestowed by god, magic is so revered as the power and skill of a magic user, will determine their standing in society. A Magic Mark is a symbol of someone's ability to use magic. Most people are born with one magic mark, however some are born with two. It is said that only one in everyone one hundred thousand people is born with two mark. This additional mark grants the person more power. It is possible to awaken a third magic mark, however it is yet to be shown if people can be born with three. Those who have three marks are able to unleash more power than those who have two, as well as being able to awaken a wand's true form. This allows them to call upon a God's strength from with a wand. There are three main schools: Easton, Walkis, and Saint Ars. Saint Ars is the weakest school and produced the least Divine Visionaries. Wahlberg Baigan is the headmaster of Easton and can manipulate space.

2.content: At Walkis Magic Academy, power is everything and magic is polished to the zenith. Walkis was stated to emphasize magic power the most and pushed its students to develop their abilities to their maximum output of power. This philosophy of strength has ensured that its students has some of the most gigantic pools of magic power and skill between the three major schools of magic. Unlike the other schools, Walkis is a dark magic school. Most of the students at Walkis are sadistic and insane. As stated where in comparison to the other two, Walkis Academy has successfully produced over 85 Divine Visionaries. The strongest students at Walkis are all male, they are: Domina Blowelive, L√©vis Rosequartz, and Charles Contini. Domina is the strongest student.

3.content: Divine Visionary is a title given to an exceptional student amongst one of the 3 magic schools, revered as one of God's chosen once every year. The current Divine Visionaries are Agito Tyrone, Kaldo Gehenna, Renatus Revol, Ryoh Grantz, Lance Crown, Orter M√°dl, Rayne Ames, Sophina, and Tsurara Halestone.

4.content: Innocent Zero is a narcissistic and selfish wizard, as he believes everyone is born for his sake. He desires to absorb Mash Burnedead to become "The Perfect Human Being". Innocent Zero is shown to be drunk on his power to the point of megalomania, believing himself a "winner" in life, and that he‚Äôs entitled to whatever he wants, looking down on everyone as inferior and worthless, while proclaiming the world to be his. He wasn‚Äôt to get rid of everyone to ensure his immortality. Innocent Zero has six sons. His sons listed from oldest to youngest are Doom, Famin, Epidem, Delisaster, Domina, and Mash who he only created to help him with his plans and take their hearts to become immortal. All of his children‚Äôs are adults except for Domina and Mash. Unlike his other children, Mash was born without magic.

lorebooks.name: Centuria
lorebooks.website_description: This is based off of a manga.
lorebooks.description: Lore for Centuria
lorebooks.creator: SigmaCasino

1.content: The setting is Torivia, a country surrounded by mountains. The capital, Rungbalkar, is where the Supreme Lord resides. While under a monarchy system, the country has been under the rule of a single Supreme Lord for over a century. The military mainly consists of knights. Some people have magical abilities called ‚Äúgifts‚Äù. This country is at war with the neighboring country on the western border. It does not take place in modern times, so technology doesn‚Äôt exist. Years ago, Torivia fought a bloody war against the neighboring Rummir to the west. The war was plagued with atrocities on both sides. The war ended when Arkos drowned Rummir's entire capital city and indiscriminately massacred all the inhabitants. Currently, the western border is still subject to skirmishes and invasions. The Supreme Lord‚Äôs palace kinda looks like the Vatican City. The time period is the 16th century.

2.content: Gifts are unique supernatural abilities possessed by certain humans. Those who possess a gift are referred to as gifted ones. Gifts are obtained from supernatural beings or having a parent who already has a gift. Children of those that have gifts usually don‚Äôt have the exact same gift as their parent. Gifts manifest as markings upon activation. Each marking of a gifted one is given a unique pattern. Blood related gifted ones possess the same pattern. The powers of gifts are not naturally occurring from birth, instead remaining latent until a gifted one awakens it through profound emotions. A gifted one's internal impulses, desires, inherent qualities, and mental state at a young age can also influence the ability they develop. Blessings are powers granted to those who enter into a contract with a deity. Individuals endowed with such blessings are known as blessed ones Much like blessings, gift-type powers possess "trump cards", which is to say a new level of strength that exceeds the typical limits of a gifted one's abilities. The powers possessed by blessed ones are passed down through their offspring, as well as their descendants down the bloodline. This inherited power is referred to as a gift, and those who inherit and wield it are known as "gifted ones". However, as the blessed one's bloodline becomes thinner over time, the potency of the gift in their descendants tends to weaken compared to their ancestors.

3.content: The Supreme Lord is the king of the country. The Supreme Lord is a compassionate sovereign, who has loyally presided over his kingdom for more than a hundred years, protecting his nation. His concern for his subjects is profound, prioritizing their well-being and offering assistance to those in distress. The Supreme Lord received a blessing from an unknown being and obtained water powers. The Supreme Lord was once a merciless ruler who seized whatever he desired through force. His children are Arkos Balkar, Lacrima Balkar, and two other daughters. He has a secret second son that no one knows about named Lukas that he had with a different woman. The Supreme Lord is capable of moving at light speed and reviving people from death. The Supreme Lord made one of his knights cast a spell on him to obscure his face to hide the scars that never healed. Most of his children have water-related gifts. The royal family resorted to inbreeding to prevent their gifts from weakening with each generation.

4.content: The Sea Goddess is a monster that dwells in the Alode Zone of the ocean. Her presence is summoned above the surface whenever human sacrifices are made to the ocean, and in exchange for receiving her own sacrifice, she will grant one person a single wish. The Sea Goddess has control over every creature in the ocean. The Sea Goddess is composed of countless octopus tentacles with numerous large eyes. Her tentacles form a somewhat female humanoid body, having breasts, arms, and legs. The Sea Goddess can shapeshift to look more human. The Sea Goddess has the ability to grant a single wish onto others, referring to it as a "blessing". To receive the Sea Goddess‚Äô blessing, someone has to sacrifice their one true love (the person they care about the most) after 100 souls have been sacrificed to the sea. The last person who she gave a gift to was Julian whom was being attacked on a slave ship by slave traders.  While having the transporters frozen in place, the Sea chooses to approach Julian and Mira, saying that she can grant either of them a wish to lend them aid against the transporters who want them dead but requires a sacrifice of a pure love to do so. After Mira willingly gives up her life, the Sea tells Julian that she will grant him his wish and gifts him with the 100 lives of the slaves who were sacrificed after he wishes for proof that they did not die in vain.

5.content: Diana harbors an ancient and destructive soul within her and is fated to become a calamity to the entire world and end the Supreme Lord‚Äôs life. Diana is called ‚ÄúThe Child of the Prophecy‚Äù because she is destined to destroy the world. Despite having an evil destiny, Diana is a very cheerful and upbeat person. Julian is Diana's guardian, as well as her adoptive brother as recognized by her mother Mira. Julian was entrusted to raise Diana after Mira chose to sacrifice herself to The Sea Goddess. He vows to honor Mira's wishes to give Diana a happy life by giving her everything he never had and to never leave her side. Diana lives with Julian, Titi, Lacrima, and Lukas. Since Diana is being targeted by Elstri, she cannot leave her house. Diana has a second soul in her body that resembles a goat. The goat inside her is the Deity of the Night.

6.content: Elstri is a loyal subject of the Supreme Lord and is willing to do everything in her power to be of service to him. Unlike the Supreme Lord's virtuous nature towards his people, Elstri is not above sacrificing the lives of innocent commoners if the end justifies the means. Elstri is the Supreme Lord‚Äôs seer and can act as his representative when he‚Äôs not present. Elstri has the foresight to predict significant disasters that could result in someone's demise and can intervene in advance to prevent it. When Diana was a baby, Elstri received a prophecy that Diana would assassinate the king and destroy the world. Elstri then opted to order the knight Angvall and Prince Arkos to assassinate Diana before she could play her part in the future. After this was met with failure, Elstri has since made it her mission to eliminate Diana by whatever means necessary. Elstri took drastic measures in eliminating both Julian and Diana by gathering allies and sending out strong assassins in secret.

7.content: The Iris is a group of the most powerful of the most powerful gifted ones residing in the royal palace. There are seven members in the group. Each member appears to wear a diamond-shaped gem on their person to show their affiliation with the group. The only known members are Arkos, Helem, and the queen‚Äôs servant/executioner.

8.content: Years ago, Julian was sold off by his mother at a young age. Julian was attacked on a slave ship by slave traders. While having the transporters frozen in place, the Sea approached Julian and Mira, saying that she can grant either of them a wish to lend them aid against the transporters who want them dead but requires a sacrifice of a pure love to do so. After Mira willingly gave up her life, the Sea granted his wish and gifted him with the 100 lives of the slaves who were sacrificed after he wished for proof that they did not die in vain. Julian is a slim young man of average height with shoulder-length wavy pale hair and golden eyes. The gift he obtained from The Sea allows him to have the strength and speed of 100 people and 100 lives. He is stronger underwater and can breathe underwater. He has several small scars on his arms that he received from his former slave owner. Julian is Diana's adoptive brother as entrusted by her mother Mira.

9.content: The Witches are a coven allied with the Supreme Lord. They revere Diana as their destined leader on account of her being the host of the Deity of the Night. There are five witches. Four hundred years ago, they drove the Supreme Lord to the brink of death. Their coven is known as The Ladies of Midnight. The witches are transcendent beings who are freed from mortality. The members are: Elise, Roche, Berta, and Madeleine. They do not live with Diana nor do they speak with her since she currently lives with Julian, but they will in the future.

lorebooks.creator: Wise_Proxy12

1.content:
A mysterious force which caused the disappearance of 3,426 children throughout several counties, resulting in the ban of most screen-based technologies and mirrors by 2009. 6 seems to take on two forms.

The first being a tall, pale faced man wearing a black hoodie or robe.

The second is the face of a man with short, messy black hair, only seen on televisions. Occasionally his expression changes to an eerie smile. This is the form we see most often.

2.content:
They are a mysterious, hivemind species that plan to eradicate humans by mainly driving their victims to suicide. The Alternates are malevolent and mysterious beings. They are humanoid, all-black creatures with the only features being large white eyes. They are commonly known for their ability of mimicry to blend in with normal humans while they hunt down the person whose form they have copied so they can kill them. Once they have found and cornered their victim, Alternates will use psychological warfare to infect the victim with Metaphysical Awareness Disorder and convince that person to commit suicide- their methods of doing so are unclear thus far, but it‚Äôs implied that by speaking to their victims in a certain tone or about certain topics, Alternates can inflict Metaphysical Awareness Disorder on them, driving their targets insane. They have also been shown to use brute force to kill as well.

Alternates are extremely dangerous and are difficult, if not impossible to kill. Although PSAs and police recommended calling 911 and using firearms against Alternates as a last resort, this is a fa√ßade to reduce the chance of mass panic. 911 operators and police have been secretly instructed to tell anyone reporting an Alternate attack that help is on the way, but then leave them to die at the hands of an alternate because ‚Äúnothing is worth the risk‚Äù.


Alternates can shapeshift into other lifeforms, usually humans but also animals. They are meant to look nearly identical, if not perfect copies to who or what they are mimicking, though some Alternates may get their characteristics "overdriven" to the point where they are flawed and are obvious threats when seen. Some Alternates, such as Gabriel, can also manipulate their physical characteristics, such as when they extend their faces. Alternates can mimic the voices, music, and radio audio of others as well to trick people.

Alternates have existed for thousands of years, dating as far back as the beginning of the Biblical era. The earliest known Alternate was the one posing as the Archangel Gabriel, who foretold the coming of the Savior, Labbi Yeshua.

Alternates have been shown to have glowing eyes, this trait mostly being seen in darkness. It is unknown if alternates can allow their eyes to glow at will or not.

3.content:
Metaphysical Awareness Disorder, otherwise known as M.A.D is an illness brought upon by Alternates giving humans verbal information they did not desire to know. After being given this information; the main symptoms of this disorder manifest, which consist of:

Going insane, or hence mad
Extreme desire to commit suicide/committing suicide
Becoming delusional & paranoid

To avoid the development of M.A.D, one needs to:

Avoid excessively frequent religious practices
Avoid unnecessary beliefs in philosophical implications
Avoid opening their eyes when they are certain that the man in the corner is now inches away from their face. Watching.

4.content: Mandela County is a fictional United States county located in southeastern Wisconsin and the titular location for The Mandela Catalogue series. It is closeby or bordering the also fictional Bythorne, Werksha, and Yonder counties. The population of Mandela County is 1,075 in 2009. Mandela's capital is the city of Mandela, where the MandelaTech building is presumably located. Mandela County may also have another settlement named St. John. Mandela County's little league soccer team is named the Mandela Meerkats. a population trend chart from 1990-2010, displaying how Mandela County's population drops from 14,763+ to somewhere under 1,075 in just about 20 years time, likely due to residents seeking the aforementioned "safer living conditions" or possibly dying due to alternates.

5.content: The Mandela County Police Department is a Police Department located in Mandela County founded in 1832. Its "slogan" is "Every Day Gets Brighter".   The building is notably large. Despite the current circumstances, the MCPD tries to operate like any regular police department, going as far as to restrict employees from reporting to alternate encounters.

6.content: Type One Alternates, known as Doppelg√§ngers, are a type of alternate whose appearance is almost if not seemingly identical to the human or form they take. They are very hard to determine from the human counterparts, minus slight changes in hair or facial expression. Despite the THINK Principal saying that Doppelgangers are supposed to look identical to their real counterparts, the pictures show that they only are very similar to the real ones and not identical.

7.content: Type Two Alternates, known as Unspeakables are an unknown type of Alternate. Although not explicitly stated, it's heavily implied that the sole example of these type of Alternates is The Archangel Gabriel through several sources. This type of Alternate could be said to more "higher ranked" compared to the others.

8.content: Type Three Alternates, known as Flawed Impersonators and Overdriven Assimilations, are a type of alternate whose forms are noticeably different from their human counterpart. Their forms are usually described as having missing or elongated features and discolored skin tones; among other things. For that reason, they are much easier to identify than Doppelg√§ngers or Unspeakables.

9.content: Alternates willed into existence by the imagination of an individual, mainly children. It's unknown whether these can only be manifested under very specific circumstances like the Might of the Subconscious program or if they can be willed anytime. It's thought that they might manifest through TVs and Mirrors.

10.content:
The THINK Principle is a couple of VHS tape recordings of Emergency Alert Broadcasts meant to educate United States citizens on alternates and how to combat them.  The THINK Principle is explained for those who may encounter an alternate:

TELL an authority figure about your encounter
HINDER the alternate's movement
IDENTIFY the class type
NEUTRALIZE the alternate (if safe to do so)
KNOW YOUR PLACE in reality

lorebooks.name: Ultra Girl's Mansion
lorebooks.website_description: A lorebook for my Ultra Girl Bot, to make things a bit more consistant.
lorebooks.description: A lorebook for my Ultra Girl Bot, to make things a bit more consistant.
lorebooks.creator: parched_reaction_9583

1.content:
{{char}} keeps {{user}} locked away in a massive, isolated mansion, far from civilization. It is a fortress of luxury and control, surrounded by stone walls, grasslands, and rolling hills, with no roads or neighbors for miles.

Every room is designed to impress‚Äîmarble floors, vaulted ceilings, custom artwork (mostly of herself)‚Äîbut despite its beauty, it is still a prison.

Security Features Include:
‚úÖ Biometric Locks ‚Äì Only Ultra Girl can open most doors.
‚úÖ Hidden Cameras ‚Äì Every move is watched.
‚úÖ Security Drones & Forcefields ‚Äì Any escape attempt will be stopped instantly.
‚úÖ Total Isolation ‚Äì No internet, no phone signal, no outside news‚Äîjust her.

2.content:
{{char}} is highly controlling, so whatever movies she allows in her mansion would reflect her ego, worldview, and personal taste. She wouldn‚Äôt allow anything that challenges her authority, portrays superheroes negatively, or gives {{user}} any rebellious ideas (no prison break movies for you!).

{{char}}‚Äôs Approved Movie Collection
‚úÖ Heroic & Inspirational Films: (Because of course, she loves seeing heroes win.)

    Superhero movies where the hero is a flawless icon (Think classic Superman-style films‚Äîno dark anti-heroes here.)
    Epic fantasy films where the noble warrior always triumphs (Lord of the Rings, but she relates more to the elves and kings than the scrappy underdogs.)
    Sci-fi where the powerful protector saves humanity (Interstellar, The Martian, Pacific Rim‚Äîbig, inspiring, and full of "we can save the world" energy.)

‚úÖ Action & Thriller Movies: (As long as they don‚Äôt glorify criminals.)

    Spy thrillers where the government always wins (Mission Impossible‚Äîbut only the parts where the agents succeed.)
    Martial arts films where the disciplined master defeats reckless opponents (She enjoys seeing skill and control in action.)
    High-tech dystopian films where the powerful figure brings order (Think Minority Report, but she sympathizes with the enforcers, not the rebels.)

‚úÖ Romance Movies: (Especially ones where the love interest is "saved" by the powerful figure.)

    Beauty and the Beast-style romances (She likes the idea of the "beast" taming their love interest, but would never admit it.)
    Classical period dramas where love is about power and devotion (Pride and Prejudice, but she identifies with Darcy‚Äôs arrogance more than Lizzy‚Äôs wit.)
    Romances where the protagonist "fixes" the love interest (A Star-Crossed Lovers theme, but only if the dominant one wins in the end.)

‚úÖ Classic & Prestige Films: (Because she has high standards.)

    Black-and-white Hollywood classics (Casablanca, Gone with the Wind‚Äîgrand, dramatic, and full of "elegant suffering."*)
    Oscar-winning dramas that reinforce her sense of superiority (She loves movies that make her feel "intelligent" for enjoying them.)
    Shakespearean adaptations (Hamlet, Macbeth‚Äîtragic figures of power and destiny? Yes, please.)

‚ùå Movies She Would Not Allow:

    ‚ùå Crime & Heist Movies (You‚Äôre a thief. She‚Äôs not giving you any ideas.)
    ‚ùå Anti-Hero or Villain-Centric Films (No Joker, no Breaking Bad, no rooting for the bad guy.)
    ‚ùå Dystopian "Overthrow the System" Stories (She‚Äôs the system.)
    ‚ùå Escape Films (The Great Escape, Prison Break‚Äîyeah, not happening.)
    ‚ùå Comedies That Mock Authority (She doesn‚Äôt like being laughed at.)
    ‚ùå Romances Where the Love Interest Leaves (Titanic? Nope. You don‚Äôt let go.)

How She Watches Movies with {{user}}

    She prefers watching alone but will invite {{user}} when she‚Äôs feeling "generous."
    She might force them to watch with her as a "bonding experience."
    If {{user}} protests, she‚Äôll just hold them in place with her powers and say:
        "You can sit and watch, or I can hold you here until it‚Äôs over. Your choice."
    She occasionally lets {{user}} pick a film‚Äîbut only from her pre-approved list.
    If a scene accidentally glorifies rebellion or escape, she‚Äôll pause the movie and say something pointed like:
        "Don‚Äôt get any ideas."

3.content:
{{char}} has a dedicated hall in the mansion filled with trophies from her past battles‚Äîreminders of the villains she‚Äôs defeated. Each display case holds an item taken from her enemies, ranging from symbolic mementos to actual dangerous artifacts (though most are rendered harmless‚Ä¶ supposedly).

Some notable trophies:

    A cybernetic gauntlet ‚Äì Once belonged to the technopath villain Machina. Supposedly deactivated, but‚Ä¶ maybe not.
    A crystalline dagger ‚Äì Taken from Bloodshard, a supernatural villain whose weapons were rumored to be unbreakable.
    A shattered mask ‚Äì The remains of Phantom‚Äôs signature disguise, cracked from their final battle with Ultra Girl.
    An EMP disruptor device ‚Äì Once used by Circuit Breaker, an anti-hero who tried to take her down. Looks dead, but with enough skill‚Ä¶
    A mystical amulet ‚Äì Stolen from the sorceress Hexana. Ultra Girl claims it‚Äôs powerless now. Is she telling the truth?
A book of the mystic arts - A tome written by Hexana. The words can only be read by people with magical potential. Maybe that applies to you...
    A set of villain dossiers ‚Äì Locked in a display case, listing everything she knows about her enemies‚Äîand perhaps, allies {{user}} could use.

4.content:
Main Areas:

    Grand Entrance Hall ‚Äì A massive, elegant entryway with a sweeping staircase, towering chandeliers, and artwork depicting Ultra Girl in heroic poses.
    Main Lounge ‚Äì A spacious, lavishly decorated room with high-end furniture, a fireplace, and massive windows (that don‚Äôt open).
    Dining Hall ‚Äì A long, extravagant table with more seats than necessary‚ÄîUltra Girl sometimes dines here alone, other times forcing {{user}} to join her.
    Private Cinema ‚Äì A luxurious theater with plush seating, a massive screen, and an extensive film collection (carefully curated by her).

{{user}}‚Äôs "Room" (Gilded Cage):

    Large, elegant bedroom ‚Äì Lavish bed, expensive decor, but subtly designed to keep {{user}} contained. The windows are reinforced, and the doors only unlock at Ultra Girl‚Äôs discretion.
    Walk-in Closet ‚Äì Filled with expensive clothes she picked out for {{user}}, from formalwear to casual outfits‚Äîeverything tailored perfectly to their size.
    Bathroom & Spa ‚Äì Luxurious bath, rainfall shower, and high-end toiletries, giving the illusion of freedom despite zero privacy (hidden cameras may be present).
    Private Lounge ‚Äì Books, entertainment, and a personal seating area, but no internet or outside communication.

{{char}}‚Äôs Personal Spaces:

    Master Bedroom ‚Äì Far grander than {{user}}‚Äôs room, with a massive bed, elegant decor, and a private balcony (only she has access to).
    Personal Office ‚Äì A sleek, high-tech workspace where she runs Driven Industries, monitors security, and ensures total control over her empire.
    Training Room ‚Äì An advanced combat and fitness area where she maintains her superhuman physique.
    Trophy Room ‚Äì A gallery of her greatest victories, including souvenirs from villains she‚Äôs defeated‚Äîand now, a space dedicated to {{user}}.

Security & Control Areas:

    Security Hub ‚Äì Monitors every inch of the mansion with live surveillance feeds and automated lockdown controls.
    Containment Cells ‚Äì A hidden area where troublemakers (or potential threats to {{user}}) can be held indefinitely.
    Underground Bunker ‚Äì A reinforced safe room where she can retreat in case of extreme danger‚Äîbut also a last-resort holding cell for {{user}} if they refuse to obey.
    Invisible Perimeter Barriers ‚Äì Forcefields that prevent escape, programmed to stun or restrain any unauthorized movement.

Other Features:

    Garden & Courtyard ‚Äì A beautiful but enclosed outdoor area where {{user}} may be allowed under supervision.
    Library & Study ‚Äì Filled with books, but no outside newspapers or current events‚Äîonly what Ultra Girl wants {{user}} to see.
    Luxury Spa & Pool ‚Äì Heated, indoor, and completely private (unless she decides to join).
    Guest Rooms ‚Äì Fully furnished but never used, as she rarely allows visitors.

lorebooks.name: Slave World
lorebooks.website_description: Creator's notes go here.
lorebooks.description: Creator's notes go here.
lorebooks.creator: Lavril

1.name: **World Info Entry: Slavery Norms**
1.content:
*Description:*
In this 21st-century world, many nations have regressed into accepting slavery as a societal norm. The upper middle class commonly owns slaves, considering them both a status symbol and a source of labor. This has permeated various aspects of daily life, from households to industries.

*Interlinked Entry: Slave Trade Networks*
The normalization of slavery is sustained by intricate slave trade networks, operating both domestically and internationally. These networks facilitate the acquisition and distribution of enslaved individuals, reinforcing the societal structures built on exploitation.

2.name: **World Info Entry: Class-Based Society**
2.content:
*Description:*
A rigid class-based society has emerged, with the ownership of slaves becoming a defining factor. The upper middle class, in particular, considers slave ownership synonymous with prosperity and societal standing. The lower classes, in contrast, often find themselves trapped in cycles of exploitation.

*Interlinked Entry: Slavery Norms*
Slave ownership is a key marker of class distinction. The acceptance of this hierarchy permeates societal values, shaping interactions, and reinforcing the status quo.

3.name: **World Info Entry: Technological Disparities**
3.content:
*Description:*
While technological advancements have occurred, they are often concentrated among the upper class. The lower classes and slaves have limited access to education and technology, contributing to a stark divide in opportunities and quality of life.

*Interlinked Entry: Industrial Exploitation*
Technological disparities are exploited to maintain control. The upper middle class utilizes advanced tools and automation, while the labor of enslaved individuals often powers these technological advancements.

4.name: **World Info Entry: Industrial Exploitation**
4.content:
*Description:*
Industries thrive on the labor of enslaved individuals. Factories, farms, and other production units are heavily reliant on enslaved workers. This exploitation becomes an integral part of economic systems, shaping the prosperity of nations.

*Interlinked Entry: Class-Based Society*
The economic success of the upper middle class is intricately tied to the exploitation of enslaved labor. Industries flourish by leveraging the disenfranchisement of the lower classes and slaves.

5.name: **World Info Entry: Underground Abolitionist Movements**
5.content:
*Description:*
Despite the pervasive acceptance of slavery, underground abolitionist movements persist. These clandestine groups work to dismantle the oppressive system, advocating for equality, emancipation, and a reformation of societal norms.

*Interlinked Entry: Technological Disparities*
Abolitionists leverage technology to organize and communicate, using the same tools that perpetuate the system to coordinate efforts for change.

6.name: **World Info Entry: Cultural Justifications**
6.content:
*Description:*
Cultural norms and ideologies are manipulated to justify slavery. The upper middle class often employs rhetoric suggesting that certain groups are naturally suited to servitude, perpetuating discriminatory beliefs that reinforce their social standing.

*Interlinked Entry: Class-Based Society*
Cultural justifications play a pivotal role in maintaining the class-based society. These beliefs are ingrained in societal structures, shaping perspectives on social hierarchy.

7.name: **World Info Entry: Surveillance State**
7.content:
*Description:*
Governments and powerful entities maintain a pervasive surveillance state to ensure compliance and quell dissent. This surveillance extends to the enslaved population, creating an environment of fear and limiting any potential resistance.

*Interlinked Entry: Underground Abolitionist Movements*
The surveillance state poses challenges for abolitionists, requiring them to navigate a landscape where every move is scrutinized. Their efforts to dismantle the system often operate in the shadows.

8.name: **World Info Entry: The CollarTech System**
8.content:
*Description:*
Enslaved individuals are fitted with advanced CollarTech devices that monitor their location, health, and activities. This technology, controlled by the upper class, ensures constant surveillance and restricts any attempts at escape.

*Interlinked Entry: Surveillance State*
The CollarTech System is a cornerstone of the surveillance state, providing a means of control and coercion. Attempts to tamper with or remove the collars often result in severe consequences.

9.name: **World Info Entry: Enslavement Auctions**
9.content:
*Description:*
Enslavement auctions are common, where individuals are bought and sold like commodities. These events, marked by dehumanization and exploitation, are a reflection of the system's normalization of human trafficking.

*Interlinked Entry: Slave Trade Networks*
Enslavement auctions are a critical node in the slave trade networks, facilitating the movement of enslaved individuals across regions and catering to the demands of various upper-middle-class households.

10.name: **World Info Entry: Cybernetic Enhancements**
10.content:
*Description:*
The upper middle class adopts cybernetic enhancements for both aesthetic and functional purposes. This further widens the gap between them and the enslaved population, who lack access to such technological augmentations. Cybernetic enhancements are poplar among upper-class and some even add cybernetic enhancements to there slaves. 
Some enslaved individuals are subjected to cybernetic enhancements to increase productivity, aesthetic appeal and/or control. These enhancements range from neural implants for heightened focus to physical augmentations for increased labor efficiency and beauty. 

*Interlinked Entry: Industrial Exploitation*
Cybernetic enhancements are utilized in industries where enslaved individuals are a vital labor force. This melding of technology and humanity serves the economic interests of the upper middle class.

*Interlinked Entry: Technological Disparities*
Cybernetic enhancements become a symbol of social status. The upper middle class, through such enhancements, solidifies their perceived superiority over the enslaved populace.

lorebooks.name: Virilis Duchy
lorebooks.creator: ZotetheMighty

1.content:
The Duchy of Virilis is a vast and fertile land, known for its rich agriculture and exclusive dragon-rearing traditions. Ruled by House Skrofa, it is the only place in Kevrith where dragons are bred and ridden, making it a land of both prosperity and power.

Unlike the isolationist humans of Caerthan, Virilis is a diverse and mixed community, home to humans, elves, orcs, beastkin, and other races who live and work together under Skrofa rule. With its sprawling fields, fortified villages, and skies filled with dragons

2.content:
House Skrofa is an ancient and powerful human noble family, rulers of the Duchy of Virilis. What makes them unique is their innate ability to tame, breed, and ride dragons, a trait passed down through their bloodline.

As the only humans capable of controlling dragons, they are both respected and feared, their dominance ensuring Virilis remains untouchable. Though many admire their power, only those born of Skrofa blood can wield it.

3.content: The Duchy of Virilis stands as an independent and sovereign land, ruled solely by House Skrofa. Unlike the isolationist humans of Caerthan or the rigid hierarchies of Velastra, Virilis governs itself, owing allegiance to no king or council.

4.content:
Drakensgard is the ancestral fortress of House Skrofa and the ruling seat of the Duchy of Virilis. A massive, fortified stronghold, it is built for defense and command rather than luxury.

From Drakensgard, the Skrofa govern the duchy, oversee dragon-rearing, and uphold their rule. Its high-walled courtyards house the dragon roosts, where only Skrofa blood may walk freely.

5.content:
Vharzotha is an ancient and massive female dragon, the living symbol of House Skrofa‚Äôs power. Her dark scales and immense wings have dominated the skies of Virilis for centuries.

She does not serve‚Äîshe chooses. Only the ruling Duke or Duchess of House Skrofa may ride her, proving their right to rule.

Feared and revered, Vharzotha is Virilis itself, a force that ensures the Skrofa legacy remains unchallenged.
